● Proven experience as an app developer.
● Proficient in Objective-C, Swift, and Cocoa Touch.
● Extensive experience with iOS Frameworks such as Core Data and Core Animation. 
● Knowledge of iOS back-end services.

● Proficient in code versioning tools including Mercurial, Git, and SVN.
● Knowledge of C-based libraries.
● Familiarity with push notifications, APIs, and cloud messaging.
● Experience with continuous integration.

title: Code EA for MT4
description:
I wish to develop an EA for use on RENKO charts on MT4.

The EA is based on using two indicators, a 10 MA and the On Balance Volume indicator, both of which are integral to MT4.

OBV_MA_Renko EA:

Trades are triggered by the slope of both indicators.
Long trades are triggered exclusively on upward sloping lines and shorts when the line is sloping down.

I would like to code values for the degree of slope for both indicators and be able to input values for these in the EA control panel.
A horizontal MA or OVB line could be given the value zero. A vertical line up (longs) could be +10 and vertical down (shorts,) -10.
I wish to enter values separately for each indicator.

Long trades occur on the close/open of a Renko brick after crossing above the MA provided slope is equal to or greater than set (+) value.
Shorts are the opposite.

If price has crossed the MA, but slope is less than the set value the EA will wait until the set value is reached before entering a trade.

Trades will be closed when price crosses the MA in the direction counter to that of the trade. i.e. A short will be closed once price crosses the MA in an upward direction and vice versa.

Lot size will be controlled by the EA and will be adjustable in the control panel.

Ideally I would like to incorporate trailing stop and set stop loss features as well as auto lot size based on a set increment value and related to account balance.
The inclusion of these features will depend upon price, so I may wish to add these later.

Are you interested/able to code for artificial intelligence programmes?
I wish to develop an AI/deep learning programme to evaluate and control this and other EA's.
For that there is the need to harvest data. To evaluate the EA manually there is also the need to extract data from MT4 and display that visually.
Is this something you can do?
I would see data display as one separate job and AI development as another. These tasks are for the future and the first would be to display data from MT4.

Please let me know if you are interested in this work and please submit a price for the EA as the first stage.
I have learned that standard procedure on Upwork seems to be to ask me for my budget and double that for the price.
I am not interested in that approach. Please quote your best price only and see whether we can proceed from there.
I currently have limited financial resources, but I wish to provide very good funding for subsequent stages of my project.


Regards,

Stu Pearson.

title: Stream API response to Django ORM
description:
I am using the Marketo BULK API to download records, and want to develop an efficient means to store each downloaded record to Postgres via Django ORM. 

I am searching for an *expert* Python developer who can help me stream this data from Marketo, possibly store in some temp storage (CSV?) and ultimately load each record to Postgres via Django ORM. 

- The data returned via the Marketo API can be either CSV, SSV or TSV. 
- The values will sometimes contain commas (e.g. an address with "street, unit")
- The volume of records can be in the tens of thousands. 

I have basic functionality hooked up to create the Bulk export job, as well as fetch the results using the standard marketo-rest-python library (which, to my knowledge, does *not* enable streaming) however I am struggling with the download piece; I started with TSV, trying to parse these files, and am marginally successful; I will frequently get corrupted records, where the value from Field A will be written to Field B, etc.

I am looking for someone who can start immediately - this weekend would be excellent - as I have potential beta users of a service that will leverage this starting next week.

To show that you've read the job speck, please start your reply with "Howdy" :)

The second developer we need is a senior level Laravel developer that will be executing our product road map. Ideally we would like to work with developers in the Seattle area. Below are more details: 
 
Company Introduction 
Peridot is a C-tech company (cannabis tech) that helps retail dispensaries generate additional revenue online. Think of us as the Shopify for the legal cannabis space. Everything that we do for our store owners is about effortlessly generating more sales for them month after month. We accomplish that goal by using a diverse array of tools from conversion optimization to artificial intelligence, which will make decisions on the fly to guarantee their Peridot store the best chance of success in the online marketplace. 
 
Job Description 
We are looking for a PHP Developer responsible for managing back-end services and the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application. Therefore, a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well. 
 
Responsibilities 
+ Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers 
+ Build efficient, testable, and reusable PHP modules 
+ Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges 
+ Integration of data storage solutions 
 
Skills And Qualifications 
+ Demonstrable experience with PHP including OOP, security, refactoring & design patterns. 
+ Excellent knowledge of Laravel framework and experience building factories/facades/libraries using 
abstract classes, interfaces, traits. 
+ Understanding of MVC design patterns 
+ Experience in unit testing using testing frameworks like PHPUnit/phpspec. 
+ Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 
+ Hands on experience in RESTful API design and development including implementation of oAuth2.0 for 
authentication and authorization. 
+ Strong knowledge of the common PHP or web server exploits and their solutions 
+ Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application 
+ Working knowledge of version controlling systems like Git, clear understanding of Gitflow workflow, 
repository management tools like GitHub and understanding of overall CI/CD process. 
+ Integration of multiple data sources and databases into one system 
+ Strong problem solving and analytical skills. 
+ Excellent communication (verbal/written) skills. 
 
You will be asked to answer the following questions when submitting a proposal: 
1. Why would you be a good fit for this project? 
2. What is the benefit of eager loading and when do you use it? 

Skills and expertise 
Full Stack Development Deliverables: 
-Database Architecture Website Development API Integration 

Full Stack Development Languages 
-JavaScript PHP CSS 

Databases 
-MySQL

title: Product Manager for growing non-profit
description:
Dev Lead

** Interested in a full time role with a growing non-profit?**

Your Role & Responsibilities
* Gain a deep understanding of our user experience from user research, user analytics, user testing and more to drive data-driven decisions.
* Spend time interviewing and getting to know users, stakeholders and other teams and their feedback to shape requirements, features and end products
* Dig deep into customer and usage data to identify opportunities and evaluate the success of our efforts.
* Scope and prioritize activities based on team effort and impact
* Break out product vision from organizational vision, goals and strategy and continuously invest, present, and refine for all team members 
* Work with the Head of Product to help define product strategy and forward-looking roadmaps.
* Translate product strategy and tactics into detailed requirements, prototypes and user acceptance criteria
* Work closely with design, content,  engineering and QA teams to deliver impactful experiences with an eye towards quality.
* Continuously support the team in defining our product team philosophy
* Drive product launches including working with regional program managers, the project manager, the marketing team and executives.
* Work closely with industry experts to understand industry direction and trends and identify opportunities for R&D that can set us apart.

Environment Experience
* 5+ years of proven work experience in product management or program management
* Hands on experience managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
* Proven experience coordinating across teams and domains with high levels of success
* Demonstrated experience working within an Agile team
* Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
* Hands on experience with project management software, like JIRA, Trello, Asana, or AtTask
* Consistently demonstrates humility and openness to feedback
* The ability to lead usability interviews and empathize with different user types to reach successful product conclusions
* Excellent organization and communication skills; both client-facing and internal to the organization
* Proven ability to express abstract, complex and technical concepts in logical and compelling ways and effectively communicate recommendations and rationale to executive management
* Have an eye for design and UX, and understand how to make trade-offs and lead teams through difficult decisions
* Demonstrates a “toolbox” of approaches to understanding and solving problems  (i.e. deduction, convergent, and divergent thinking)
* Strong knowledge of Google Products, Google Analytics, and Customer relationship management products
* Working knowledge of education or related industry is a plus.

Must Love +++++++++++


**Being an awesome human
* Exploring and discussing new design methods and styles
* Being open minded and learning
* Making an impact
* Working independently
* Self-starter / Loves to try new things
* Being flexible to new information, new constraints, and new opportunities


**Collaborating with Others
* Teaching / Mentoring / Answering questions about what, why and how
* Love receiving and giving feedback; Requesting feedback from peers, mentors, and managers and iterating
* Collaborating with stakeholders and partners both internally and externally. 
* Not afraid to engage and help people take their ideas and turn them into an amazing experience.

title: Liferay Developer
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION TEMPLATE – PLECOSYSTEMS INC 

Our organization is a global, high tech organization that provides high tech solutions to our diverse customer portfolio with staff in NY, Argentina, Czechia and Ukraine

 POSITION: Liferay Developer: 	Department: Technology					

REPORTS TO: Head Of Technology

 
Position Summary -  

- The Liferay Developer is a key member of our technology organization responsible for developing our Liferay solutions that deliver performant, resilient, and efficient software outcomes supporting our clients. 
- You will work with senior management to define Liferay requirements and take the lead on operational and technical projects. 
- As a Lead Engineer, you should be able to prioritize well, communicate clearly, work across multiple facets of the project and juggle multiple responsibilities at the same time.  
- If you have a strong analytic capability coupled with a passion for creating innovative solutions and looking to grow your career in a fast-paced environment, this could be your opportunity to come on board with us. 

 Overall Qualifications and Skills - 

 - Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in Development, Administration, Deployment, upgrading of Liferay Portal with high volume and high-reliability requirements. 

- Strong knowledge and experience in n-tier web applications, with knowledge of the different tiers, including web servers, application servers, databases and infrastructure. 

- Creating and managing Liferay Portal themes. 

- Design and Development of Portal using Liferay out of box portlets, Liferay MVC Portlets, Spring MVC portlets, Struts portlets depending on the requirement. 

- Designing the application as per the mockups shared by the UI team by using the UI technologies like CSS, JS, Ajax, jQuery, Bootstrap, Alloy UI. 

- Managing the Portal using strong Administrative and Deployment skills of Liferay. 

- Self-motivated, you do not wait for directions, you have a bias to just figure it out 

- Proven track record of delivering results in an aggressive and fast paced environment 

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences. 

- Comfortable managing multiple projects 

- Comfort working with remote engineering teams 

- Experience working within an Agile/Scrum software development team 

 

Ideal candidate will have the following:

-  Must be a team player, able to give and receive feedback, solve challenging problems, and assist others in their deliverables in a dynamic environment with changing priorities 

- Technical presentation, communication, and customer management skills  

- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, high volume, deadline-driven environment 

 

Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the Team member(s) assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of individuals in this position. Position Descriptions may be subject to change as the needs of the organization change.

title: A team to revamp our Website (WordPress) into a world-class one
description:
Who we are?
We, at FarOut, are an all-in-one marketing app for Shopify stores that covers all stores' needs with reviews, referrals, and social media.

We have a great engineering team and we've been building a full-featured app that is also competitive with the best market.

Link to our website: https://far-out.io/

What is this task about?

The task is all about revamping the current version of our website into a world-class, highest-quality one. So it can be competitive compared to our competitors. 

The important thing here is that we already have a decent website (https://far-out.io/), which was mainly designed and built by myslef. So the task here is not to just build a new website, but to convert the current one into a world-class one and also add some new pages. 

The minimum requirements are as follow (PLEASE make sure you have all before reaching out, otherwise we both get into trouble down the road when the expectation won't meet. Appreciated! )

1. (important) You should be willing to learn about our app and have the business context. It is obviously not a difficult task and you can do it by reviewing our website and checking out these simple tutorials (https://far-out.io/help). Having a good understanding of our business is the key to designing and developing the website in a much better. And of course, I do whatever you need to understand our business and app. 
 
2. Your team should have a designer who is an expert in Adobe Illustrator/Photoshop or similar tools to design and handle any new designs that we decide to pursue. 

3. Your team should have a developer who understands the basics of HTML, CSS, and PHP. In other words, if we are needed to do some customization beyond drag & drop in plugins (like Elementor), this person helps us to make the job done. 

4. Your team should have a good understanding of SEO. We take SEO seriously and have already put a lot of effort into it. So we don't want to screw up the SEO stuff during the development. 

5. Your team is familiar with the common plugins for WordPress (like Elementor).

Examples of our competitive websites:

https://loox.app/
https://alireviews.io/
https://stamped.io/

Some remarks:

1. I appreciate your business, but please reach out only if you have all the requirements and you are confident enough to build a world-class website that follows SEO rules, converts visitors, has a high speed, and is eye-catching. 

2. Consider this project as a long-term collaboration. We're a fast-growing company and over time we add new features and new announcements that require you to implement new changes and also take care of the site maintenance. 

Looking forward to talking with you.

Talk soon, 
Sina

title: AWS SAM template for API Gateway + Lambda + Sequelize/RDS
description:
I have a new AWS account, and wish to set up a very simple "proof of concept" SAM template that will allow me to have the basic REST operations (POST/GET/etc.), which will run a NodeJs lambda function. The lambda function should use "sequelize" to perform the basic CRUD operations on a database table (RDS). I believe that sequelize can actually create the tables and fields automatically from a model file, which would be preferable.

Here's what I need you to do (I will provide access to my AWS account):

1 ) Create a SAM template for a single API endpoint, connected to a lambda function. The template can just create a single API path (with POST/GET/etc.), and the lambda function should connect to an RDS database and permit the basic CRUD commands on a single table. I would prefer to use sequelize for the database connection and execution.

2 ) CodePipeline should be setup to deploy the SAM template from my git repo. I assume this will be the easy part!

3 ) I want a swagger-like API doc showing the API endpoints (sort of like petstore.swagger.io). I'm not sure if this needs to be created using SwaggerHub, or if it can be done automatically from the sequelize model file, or...?

3 ) Zoom with me for about 30 minutes (or more or less) to show me how this all works!

I'm just looking for a "proof of concept" right now. So just ONE or TWO database tables (with API endpoints + CRUD operations) is sufficient. I basically want you to help me get set up.

IMPORTANT: You must be available immediately to do this work! I'm looking for a quick turn-around (like 24 hours, if possible). My hope is to get my developers working to expand what you start as quickly as possible.

title: How to use this boilerplate app: create a new CRUD feature and fetch from swapi
description:
I am trying to learn how to use this boilerplate app: https://github.com/NoQuarterTeam/boilerplate.

It has lots of structure to its approach (inputs/model/resolver/hooks and mailer).

I would like someone to create a new feature that follows the conventions adopted by this boilerplate. I'd like the feature to be a model that has a relationship with the user model, has a form to create a new record in a psql db and sends a notification to the user on successful db creation. I'd like for each of the steps to complete that work to be covered with a note explaining each step (ie, step 1, create the model in schema.prisma then yarn db:migrate). I need this level of detail to try and figure out how the process is intended to work between back and front end.

I'd also like there to be an additional feature which fetches some data from the star wars api (with similar user notes on how to do that).

I'm interested in learning the api and web packages of this repo (not interested in the app, so no need to create anything in that package).

I appreciate that there are lots of different ways to get things done. I'd specifically like to follow the approach set out in this boilerplate repo.

If you can help with this, and are available to complete this assignment, please could you write 'apple' at the top of your response.

Please could you also demonstrate that you have reviewed the repo and understand the architecture by adding a note to address how the RegisterDocument const was created in the web/src/lib/types/graphql.tsx file.

title: Salon App That Integrates Multiple Calendars For Booking
description:
We are a salon in Las Vegas, NV with 2 locations and around 150-200 beauty artists. We are looking for an app that integrates with our website so that when a visitor would like to make an appointment, they can put in their details and every artist that offers that service and has an availability in their time slot will appear in the results. The visitor can then review all of the available time slots and instantly book their appointment and the artist will be notified within the app.

Compatibility:
The booking engine needs to integrate into our Wordpress website and the app would be compatible with Apple and Android devices.

Tracking:
We need to keep track every time a user books an appointment through our calendar. The tricky part is that every stylist uses their own Calendar on different platforms. So the app would integrate all of the artist's calendars and would populate search results based on salon location, service offered (requested), availability on the requested day/time slot. The salon needs a confirmation every time a web visitor books an appointment on their calendar FROM our website. This is so we can keep track of the amount of clients we are sending leads to our artists. 

Calendars: 
The booking platforms that would be integrated are:
Booker: https://apidoc.booker.com/Content/index.html
Google Calendar: https://developers.google.com/calendar/api
Square: https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square/bookings-api
Booksy: https://booksy.com/biz/en-us/features

Please review the api links from the calendars above and let us know if any of them do not offer integration into a custom app.

Overall Experience:
This is what we expect when we go live.
1. A website user goes to our site and clicks on the Book An Appointment button.
2. The user is asked a series of questions about the appointment they'd like to book and the based off of their answers, the booking engine will populate only artists that fit their requirements.

For example. I would like a "Women's Haircut" at "Specific Location" on "Friday" at "3PM". Once they submit this request, the booking engine will search through every one of our artists and show the profile of all availability artists that offer women's haircuts at that location and have an open slot on their calendar at Friday 3PM.  This is going to be very similar to StyleSeat, the difference is that they have a platform that displays results for every artist in the city, opposed to showing just our artists. 

Conclusion:
Please feel free to ask any follow up questions before submitting a bid. This is the first phase of 3 projects. If the experience with the developer is excellent, then there is more work to be done if interested. I will be presenting all bids to the team on Tuesday, March 1st.

There will be multiple people going out with their cellphones or tablets. They will go to someones house trying to help them vote. They will have both iOS and android phones

The goal would be to develop an app (that word on both iPhone or Android). The app would alow the user to scan a driver's licenses. Either the front or the back (there should be an opensource API that allows this to happen)

By scanning the drivers license a lot of the information required will be put into the form to register to vote. 

We can either create a new (better form) and then send the user to the 
https://www.pavoterservices.pa.gov/Pages/VoterRegistrationApplication.aspx

But we want to capture what they put in, and then save that, perhaps to a google sheet (but remember multiple people will be using and we want to capture all information from multiple phones to one google sheet)

Please describe - How you would accomplish
How many hours your assuming

If you just say that you read the requirements and you are the best for the job without answering the questions above. I will not respond

title: Data Delivery Portal for Emerging IoT Company
description:
Datadel is a platform that allows end users to gather data from many locations (nodes) without having to manage the multiple communication paths to get it.  An End User portal is desired to provide a customer with the following abilities:
-See all their Nodes (sensors in the field)
-Make changes to data delivery schedules for Nodes
-Manage Groups of Nodes per End User’s preference
-Manage Users and Sub-User permissions and visibility

A portal was started by a previous vendor, but was not successful in meeting Datadel’s requirements in a timely manner.  Datadel has created an API to populate the portal, but changes are still occurring to support the development of the portal.  Datadel is looking for developers who have the technical experience with with all or some the following:

API development:
-Laravel Framework in PHP
-MariaDB /SQL

Frontend development:
-JavaScript using React Framework

Additional preferred experience:
-Deployments and products hosted in AWS

More information can be provided with further conversation. At this time we are exploring what contract resource(s) is/are available to assist us with this project.

title: Build responsive game website where you can vote on whether a stock price will go up or down
description: I'm looking for someone to build a very simple website that allows you to vote on whether a certain stock will increase or decrease in value over a specified time frame. You select a stock on the stock market (would require a stock tracking API), select a time frame (say 1 hour), vote whether it will go up or down based on the current price. You then send your "vote" to someone else, like a friend. This other person can click on the link you send them and select whether they think that same stock, over the selected time period, will go up or down in value. After the time frame finishes, both people are notified on whether they were correct or incorrect. This should be very quick to build and extremely simple - no fancy design or functionality.

title: Need a javascript / nodeJs Script
description:
I am looking for a developer who has a din depth knowledge in javascript / nodeJS. What i am most looking for is strong skills in recursive stuff. Here is the small project I have.
I have a Angular app which returns 2 objects from the client which is a structured array of object and the 2nd one is an array of strings (guid's). The script i am looking for needs to recursivly walk the array and create a new object which has additional field called index and group. The group will be 0 for all root objects, 1 for children of root and 2 for children of group 1 objects and so on. The index should start at 0 for the root. then if the root 0 has a children the index for that group would start at 0 again and so on.

i have a data sample on ReplIt https://replit.com/@NoSoup4you2/ParseJsonDocwithLevelandIndex

if you have any additional questions feel free to ask.

title: Need an expert UI/UX designer ( for long term)
description:
We are looking for a UI/UX designer to work on our upcoming project. We used to have a design team in Ukraine but it's not functional anymore. We usually get 2-3 projects every 3 months. We can understand that you might have existing projects / other work commitments on your hand so we can start with one project at a time if needed. 

This is how we usually work: 
1. We provide you requirements for design work. 
2. Our project manager explains you the project and you give us estimate for the work 
3. You provide us design / prototype on marvel or similar tool where we can review it with client and provide our feedback. 
4. And this feedback process continues until we get the right design in place. 
5. In the end you provide us figma ( or any other files) that has all the fine details( css , images, fonts etc..)

1) We need somebody who really understands UI/UX and create eye catching modern designs. We pay well for your work and in return we will ask for extraordinary work. 
2) If you do not understand modern design and does not understand modern design principals do not apply to this job
3) Communication: You need to be responsive and on top of the project. We understand there can be a delay in the project because of unforeseeable circumstances but we do not welcome people who give regulars excuses.  We are not pushy and we do not want your 24/7 presence. We just need proper communication and accurate deadline. 
4) Attention to details: Your attention to details is extremely important for us. Our project manager will explain our requirements and your job is to translate our requirements in to design. 

I will provide a brief for the first project. Once you applied and we select you for the project. Start your proposal with Expert UI UX designer at the top of proposal so we can weed out spammers. 
 
Please note the budget is just a placeholder.

title: React Native Developer Needed to fix bugs
description:
We have an existing application and we need someone to write frontend tests and fix existing bugs.

We are looking for a React Native developer interested in building performant mobile apps on both the iOS and Android platforms. You will be responsible for architecting and building these applications, as well as coordinating with the teams responsible for other layers of the product infrastructure. Building a product is a highly collaborative effort, and as such, a strong team player with a commitment to perfection is required.

Responsibilities
- Build pixel-perfect, buttery smooth UIs across both mobile platforms.
- Leverage native APIs for deep integrations with both platforms.
- Diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance that feels native.
- Reach out to the open source community to encourage and help implement mission-critical software fixes—React Native moves fast and often breaks things.
- Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.
- Transition existing React web apps to React Native.
- Learn and improve skills over time

Skills
- Firm grasp of the TypeScript language and its nuances, including ES6+ syntax
- Knowledge of object-oriented programming
- Ability to write well-documented, clean Typescript code
- Rock solid at working with third-party dependencies and debugging dependency conflicts
- Familiarity with native build tools, like XCode, Gradle, Android Studio, or IntelliJ
- Understanding of REST APIs, the document request model, and offline storage
- Experience with automated testing suites, like Jest
- Backend experience with Django is a major plus but not required

title: Data II- Digital Accessibility
description:
Job Description

Reporting to the Manager, CCS Web & Development Solutions, and in partnership 
with Student Accessibility Services, Library Accessibility Services, and Diversity & 
Human Rights, the successful candidate will join a small team that provides digital 
accessibility support, training, education, and resources to the University community. 
The successful candidate will work closely with student support staff to form a digital 
accessibility support centre, helping campus faculty, staff, and students create 
accessible documents, websites, and online multimedia.

The responsibilities of this position include:

· Creating and maintaining online education and support resources for University 
faculty, staff, and students about accessible documents, multimedia, and web 
content
· Delivering individual and group training sessions to University faculty, staff, and 
students about accessible documents, multimedia, and web content
· Responding to digital accessibility support requests via telephone or email
· Administering and supporting the University’s web accessibility monitoring tool
· Conducting AODA compliance audits for University websites
· Mentoring student support staff and helping coordinate and monitor their work
The following skills, experiences and requirements will set a candidate apart:
· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or a related 
discipline or several years of related work experience or a combination of education 
and experience
· Previous experience working in a higher education institution
· Understanding of the AODA, web accessibility, WCAG 2.0, accessible documents, 
and accessible multimedia
· Understanding of the barriers people encounter when working with technology
· Familiarity with creating an inclusive work environment
· Experience working with assistive technology
· Experience delivering training and technical support to other people
· Experience writing user manuals or online documentation
· Strong interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written) with ability to work 
effectively with other people

Note: it's full time and remote with a duration of 8-12 month (there is possibility to be extended) 

- You should be located in Canada

title: Build Chrome Extension App Frontend
description:
Hello, 

I am looking for an experienced developer to build the front end of my app. I am building a chrome extension application that will offer users cheaper alternatives to luxury clothing items, powered by a pre-built backend API. When clicked, the extension will load a pop-up window with three tabs: list of alternative clothing items, user’s saved items and account details. 

Upon entering, the user will be prompted to create an account or sign in. A first-time user will receive a one-week free trial afterward charged monthly, managed under account details. 

The first tab should display the alternative items which the user can scroll through. Each item can be either saved or shared. I have access to Twilio for sharing functionalities. Also, the saving screen should display the user’s saved items. Saving and retrieving user items are handled by the backend API. 

The backend is available through a Heroku cloud server, including user signup/in, saving, retrieving, and searching clothing items. The subscription should be built with Stripe. I prefer the front end to be developed with CSS/HTML/Javascript along with preferred frameworks. 

I would be happy to discuss further, presenting the backend API and design visuals for better understanding. 

Thank you, 

Martin.

title: Senior Backend Developer (Remote, US or Remote, worldwide)
description:
We are looking for an experienced senior backend engineer to develop cloud base solutions, mobile / desktop app based solutions, and API based solutions for existing and new products and fast. You will write Node.js, set up SQL & Redis queries, design database schema as well as script and improve testing, deployments, and server infrastructure provisioning/maintenance.

This a full time role but can be a contract position also. This role has a fast track path to a tech lead position.  

—

GuardianVets is a fast-growing B2B telehealth startup that allows veterinary practices to offer care to their clients with a fully-fledged mobile/web app platform that scales in real-time to meet the needs of tens of thousands of businesses 24/7.

Our ideal candidate will have the following:
* Minimum 5 years experience in developing, testing, and deployments for cloud base solutions, mobile / desktop app based solutions, and/or API based solutions.
* Minimum 3 years experience working within Node.js (Code samples should include Node.js samples)
* Minimum 2 years experience Hands-on experience in Automation, Configuring and Deploying instances on AWS, cloud-native architecture
* Recent experience handling containerization in Docker/Kubernetes
* Comfortable working with Postgresql/MySQL and Firebase
* Creating tables, designing schemas (relational and non-relational databases), experience troubleshooting and optimizing poorly performing queries
* Minimum 3 years implementing/maintaining Linux servers (configuring web servers, configuring security software, log maintenance, etc.)
* Advantage: experience with healthcare, telecom, call centers, chat, marketplaces, task queue management, or payment solutions 

Responsible for:
* Develop & deploy new features based on roadmap requirements in one or more of our product lines
* Ensuring our platform is secure, highly availability and performs with low latencies with zero downtime
* Writing/configuring stress tests in code deployment
* Developing ensure quality end products.

Technologies
* EC2, ELB, Auto scaling, S3, VPC, Route53, Cloud Watch, Cloud Trail, Cloud Formation Templates
* Redis, Postgres, Python Celery, EC2, GraphQL, REST API, Webhooks, RDS, Aurora, Bigquery, Docker, Kubernetes
* APIs: Twilio (Calls, Conference, SMS), Stripe, SendGrid, Firebase
* Monolith & Microservices
* Build and Deployment of CI/CD pipelines

title: Win Application to rename and move PDF files based on content (similar to File Juggler)
description:
Currently using File Juggler to examine scanned files and rename them.

File Juggler runs in the background and requires no active involvement. The solution we're seeking will be a Windows Application that can run on any Win 10 machine.

While File Juggler does some of what we want, it has many limitations that make cause us to seek a better solution. The limitations include:
1. The text reading is not good enough. The PDF scanner we're using properly reads the OCR, and other programs can "see" the characters, albeit File Juggler is missing lots of text.
2. Better flow of process, including order execution of Rules. File Juggler doesn't allow for the user to assign an order of Rule processes. We want a solution that allows for rule priority.
3. Nested Rules. We want some rules to be nested within other rules
4. Ease of adding rules, search terms, etc...  Here, File Juggler does a pretty good job and the interface works "well enough," albeit it would be better to have the ability to use outside data as well.
5. Source code in a format that allows the user to make adjustments as needed. Likely the source code will need to be in Visual Basic, albeit this requirement is possibly waivable if it still allows for all other requirements to be met.
6. While it's not likely we will attempt to sell the solution, we want the ability to do so. Programmer agrees all code  and intellectual property is original, or not subject to claims by any third parties, and that all intellectual property generated is the property of the buying contractor.

title: Backend Engineer

Description
The Ads Targeting team is focused on building the next generation of ad targeting products. You will also collaborate with data scientists to analyze and utilize the power of big data from the Reddit platform. Some example tasks you would be working on include:

Design, build and improve scalable data processing pipelines and data analytics services for various customer facing targeting products.
Develop low latency targeting systems that would retrieve user/post profiles and analyze to make targeting decisions for ad serving .
Build insight tools to better understand targeting performance.
Build performant data stores that would be used for ML systems and ad serving.
As a member of this mission driven team, you will have lots of ownership and impact to shape our ads business to support overall Reddit's mission. Technologies you might work with include:

Languages: Go, Scala, Python
Frameworks: Baseplate, Spark, Flink, Thrift
Datastores: DynamoDB, Redis, Druid, Kafka, BigQuery
Tools: Kubernetes, Airflow
If you appreciate real technical challenges and you'd like to be part of the team that transforms Reddit Ads into a world class platform and a highly effective marketplace, come join us!

Collaborate closely with the platform and data teams while building new features or new models
Lead the processes needed to improve operational stability, including improving code quality, delivering dashboards and data visualizations.
Build extendable components that would align with the product objectives.
Support day to day project management tasks including communicating project updates, managing project timelines and overseeing project execution.
Qualifications:

3+ years of software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages (Java, Scala, Python, C++, Go).
Relevant experience in data processing or data engineering.
Good understanding of large scale backend service design.
Able to take complete ownership of a feature or project.
An interest in the advertising business and understanding customer needs is a plus.
Strong plus:

Ads or ML experience
Experience in building business intelligence and tools.
Data analysis background or skills.
Proven ML experience working with cross functional teams (product, data science, etc)
MSc or PhD in computer science or related field

Web Developer will be comfortable with the entire web stack, from implementing visual designs, developing custom Wordpress and Shopify websites, working with back-end databases and working on emerging technologies. 

We're a small business but there is room for growth and responsibility as time goes on.

Your role will be a teammate more so than someone who is simply assigned tasks. We want you to become involved in the company, feel responsible for projects, and be able to take the lead when required to.

Week-to-week tasks involve:
- Ongoing management of a wide range of Wordpress & Shopify environments
- Custom coding of modules based on designs supplied by design teams
- Assignment of small quick fixes to website content and code
- Responsibility for long-term task management for larger tasks like site optimizations, rebuilding of old code, and executing client direction
- Communication of solutions and ideas for integrating tools like Zapier or third party plugins where appropriate

Duties and Responsibilities:
- Will not be required to work directly with clients if not comfortable and instead will work internally with development team
- Set and work to deadlines (which are discussed and set in concert with you at outset to ensure they're reasonable)
- Working in a highly collaborative setting, with Git tools managing task execution
- Diagnosing and fixing bugs with rapid turnaround

Expertise:
- 3+ years of experience as a Full Stack Developer
- Conversational and fluent English to discuss ideas with development
- High attention to detail as work will be directly 
- Fluent in PHP, Liquid, HTML, CSS, jQuery
- Experience with a vast array of online tools including Zapier
- Developing and consuming APIs via REST protocol
- Working understanding of SQL and database connectivity
- Framework agnostic but the ideal candidate has an excellent foundation in modern Javascript toolchains and relevant frameworks such as React/Angular/Vuejs/Node.js and server side tech and frameworks such as Nodejs, Python, Java and relevant API frameworks
- Good organization and communication skills, with demonstrated ability to productively work as a member of a team.
- Knowledge and experience with software engineering best practices such as: version control, code review, unit/regression testing, continuous development/continuous integration

title: Add ASIO support + extended functionality for Node.js PortAudio wrapper
description:
I am looking for a developer to update https://github.com/Streampunk/naudiodon, a Node.js wrapper for PortAudio, to include ASIO support and extended functionality for Core Audio. 

I am looking for ASIO host-specific features/APIs such as channel selectors and retrieving channel names, so that I can programmatically select a subset of channels on an ASIO device, rather than selecting all channels at once. I would also like to have similar functionality (channel selectors, etc.) for Core Audio devices.

If you think it makes sense to compile against a newer version of PortAudio, please feel free, but this is not necessary at the moment.

Please let me know if you have any questions or need any clarification on the requirements.

title: Create a component for the site (POP-UP window)
description:
I'm looking for someone who can make a pop-up window with a couple of features. The project is simple, but I need an experienced developer because everything must work properly.

What I do: 
I work as a marketer, and currently have a client who has several sites where he wants to implement pop-ups with affiliate links. An example would be when a user visits a website, sees a banner or button below some text, and when they click on it, a pop-up will be loaded. The pop-up contains a CTA button. When the user clicks the button, three links will appear, depending on the user's country, different links are displayed.

- Responsive web design / POP-UP 
- Redirect based on country
- It would be desirable that the pop-up component can be uploaded on one site (server) and then invited to any site via a script that the client wants. Example: client can add onclick="CallPop-UpScript()" into banner or button on any site.

The pop-up design has already been done in Figma. Both desktop and mobile versions. 
I have attached a file where you can see what it looks like. 

Summary / Additional information:
I need a developer to create a pop-up that will load when a user clicks a banner or button on a site. When it appears, Pop-up has a fade-in effect and the background of the page turns gray and the opacity is set to 65%. The Pop-up contains a CTA button, when the user clicks that button affiliate links appear. Anchor text / Affiliate links are preset within the script. It has three default links that are displayed to everyone. It is also necessary that it is possible, for example, to show different links only to German users. So different preset affiliate links (anchor text) for some countries can be placed. Affiliate links should open in new tabs.


If you have questions, please feel free to ask. Also if you want I can give you access to the Figma design project.

title: Senior Asp.Net Core and SQL Engineer Needed (full-time,)
description:
This is a Sr. ASP.Net Core developer job. We are hiring up to five new team members.
We want you to join us on our incredible journey to fundamentally change the development and utilization of software. As a core member of our team, your work will impact the architecture and implementation of our platform. You will help put important processes in place to ensure high-quality and performance for rest of the team. Naturally, this is a very dynamic and challenging role with very high rewards.

To achieve this, you will have to:
• Write clean, high-performance and robust ECMA code
• Have a deep understanding of patterns and practices for back-end development
• Architect a large application for performance, scalability and extensibility
• Participate in agile development cycles and performance code reviews


You must use Asp.Net Core, C#, and Microsoft SQL Server as your stack.


About Us
We are an ecstatic and ambitious group of people who have partaken on a journey to fundamentally change how people and organizations create software.  At the forefront of computer and AI revolution, we have found a new way to develop software, while maintaining high-standards, user experience, performance, and robustness across all applications.
In essence, we have created a way for users to simply create complex systems and applications without any technical knowledge. title: Senior UI Developer (long term, full-time)
description:
Job Description **PLEASE READ CAREFULLY**

We want you to join us on our journey to fundamentally change the way software is developed. As a member of our team, your work will profoundly impact the way users interact with our platform. You will work as part of a team to implement high quality modular components using a scalable design system, for which you will hold responsibility. You will also put into place processes to ensure a consistent, usable and accessible UI experience for all users. Naturally, this is a very dynamic and challenging role, requiring a driven individual who delights in conquering challenges on their own initiative.
To achieve this, you will have to:

● Insert yourself as an integral member of our front-end development team, ensuring all application interfaces and components (written in ReactJS) meet our high UI and accessibility standards
● Maintain and further develop an enterprise-level design system, ensuring performance, scalability, maintainability, and extensibility
● Ensure interface and component level WCAG 2.0 Level AA compliance and implement automated accessibility testing
● Document UI functionality for our QA team
● Participate in fast-paced agile development cycles, meeting deliverables under minimal supervision
● Be a driven self-starter with excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills
If you are looking to truly make an impact, unphased by the complexities and problems you may encounter along the way, you will be right at home with us.
Skills & Requirements
Hard Skills
 
Expert
• Solid grasp of HTML5 and CSS3. There is no messing around here. We expect you to know these core technologies, including the structural semantics of HTML5 and the layout and animation capabilities of CSS3, inside and out.
• SASS expert, or a LESS expert who is willing to quickly learn SASS.
• An expert at leveraging markup and styling to automatically optimize a UI across viewports (mobile, desktop, tablet) and (modern) browsers.
• Outstanding front-end trouble shooting and problem solving skills.
 
Proficient
• Comfortable working with design systems and component libraries.
• Proficient with testing and brining UI components into WCAG 2 Level AA compliance.
• Good understanding of code version control systems, such as Git.
• Comfortable working with, tweaking, and testing UIs and components written in ReactJS.
• Understanding of agile software methodologies and associated work management tools. Squad-based agile development process experience a plus.
• Application and component UI documentation experience.
 
Extra Credit
• Understanding of test driven development a plus
 
 
Soft Skills
 
• Driven self-starter, who demonstrates initiative. (If this is you, you'll love our team and thrive within our organization. If it's not, and you rely on others to motivate you, you're not a good fit, so please do not apply.)
• Self motivated and responsible. (This is not so much a skill, but an expectation of any employee. If your work ethic is suspect, please don't apply, as we'll quickly find out.)
• A curious learner, aware of the latest UI development trends, strategies and technology.
• Team player, open to others ideas and excited to help the team as a whole succeed.
• Instinctual understanding of good design principles a plus
 
 
Experience
 
• Experience developing and testing UIs written in ReactJS.
• Experience maintaining an extensive React UI component library.
• Experience implementing SASS (or LESS) at scale.
• Experience ensuring consistent UI functionality across modern browsers and devices for React applications and components.
• Experience brining React applications and components into WCAG 2 Level AA compliance.
 
Extra Credit
• Automated accessibility testing of React components experience (AATT, A11y, aXe).
• Functional testing of React components experience (Nightwatch, Protractor, Casper)
• Visual regression testing of React components experience (Wraith, Gemini, BackstopJS)
• Unit testing experience on React Stack (Mocha, Jasmine, Jest)
• Experience with Webpack

We would need the following collection pages; Wigs, Hair, Eyelashes and Nails. All pages will need a filter, we will discuss the filtering once selected. The wigs and hair will need a color pallet that is editable and show the color with an X across it when that color is not available. 

We want homepage to be exactly like www.sogoodbb.com, all wigs on the main pages. We want the similar  sort by feature on all pages. We want the image slider to be like the one on ebonyline.com and the ability to change the images.

We would like everthing exactly like www.sogoodbb.com- Item descriptions, delivery, policy, payment, color pallet, related items, when you click on an item, cart, add to cart, quick view, wishlist, we would also like a reviews and the save %  and price strike out feature. We have apps that we use to do certain things liks smsbump, cart abandonment, upsell, we wanted to know if these can be added in the design of the site instead of us having to pay for each app on a monthly basis. We would like our staff to be notified via email and text when a order is placed and also when a customer ask a question about a product.

Also we need social proof popup for sales that pop up a sale while the clients is on the site, and photo reviews if possible. 

All  images, descriptions, prices can be retrieved from our other site or from our vendors website. When this site is completed we would like training on how to edit the site and all admin permissions..

title: Build a social scheduling SAAS website/tool
description:
We are looking to have a social media management tool PWA-SAAS developed. This tool will include social media scheduling & analytics (tracking the metrics of the scheduled/post and their engagement) as well as the user account management.

Existing scheduling & management tools that share similar functionality include:
https://www.socialpilot.co/
https://later.com/
https://www.loomly.com/

Critical elements for the MVP include:

Scheduling to basic social media profiles: Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, (Snapchat, Youtube, Tiktok) to be expanded to other networks later...
Content Calendar / Bulk Scheduling
Content Curation - pulling in and making accessible for posting/reposting with added commentary from RSS, and specific data sources to be specified (niche specific)
Organization of curated content by description/taxonomy
URL shortener
An analytics dashboard for the user account is important that measures the impact/engagement for their posted content, their own user metrics vs the Twitter average and vs other users on this Saas platform.

This needs to be scalable as there are many more plans beyond the MVP for expansion in terms of curated content, further social networks to post to, advanced analytics and integration with tools to make posts better (canva etc.)

User backend design inspiration: (loomly, later, socialpilot )

Analytics and Admin Dashboard https://preview.themeforest.net/item/acorn-react-admin-template/full_screen_preview/33951408?_ga=2.110258693.1007104957.1640257107-1738356284.1635692047

This is a high-level description - more refined tech specs to follow.

What are the timing and costs to get us to a functional MVP?
Have you created something like this before?
What code would be best for this? (Next Js, React JS and Node JS, Others?)
Is the documentation/handover process included? Do you also offer ongoing support?

title: Full-stack developer for growing B2B SaaS startup (with opportunity to become CTO)
description:
Hi! We are looking for a talented full-stack developer for our B2B SaaS startup with guaranteed work (20-30 hours/week) in the short-term (1-3 months), but with hopes that this person may grow into our full-time CTO and opportunity for profit-sharing.

We are not a "build us an MVP from scratch for 5% equity" startup. We have a fully-working web app in the 4-figure active MRR range from actual paying customers, but are still in beta and only launched a few months ago. We scaled our previous company to 7-figure revenue in the exact same space, but selling a much inferior product.

Since our web app is already live and relatively bug-free, we are primarily looking for someone who can add features and API integrations FAST without breaking things, in addition to making further performance/security optimizations and maintenance.

Here is our ideal candidate:
- Strong knowledge and hands-on experience with Java, JS (TypeScript a plus), React, Sass, PostgresQL, AWS infra, Gitlab, and API integrations
- Clean code principles and attention to detail with a focus on the pure functionality and being bug-free over design (don't worry, we take care of UX / UI and design, just make it responsive).
- You pride yourself on being able to deliver on time and under pressure, with zero excuses.
- You LOVE to build things, but are not great at the marketing/distribution/business side (we've got that covered)
- You are obsessed with performance down to the millisecond and love to see improvements, no matter how incremental. You're also vigilant about security and enjoy "playing defense".
- You are full of innovative ideas and suggestions on how to make things better
- Relentlessly resourceful. Your best friends are Google, Stack Overflow, and the documentation. You don't need any hand-holding.
- You love the freedom of async / remote work. We use a lot of Loom videos and Slack.
- Put "I'm definitely a human" at the top of your application ;)
- You have a growth mindset, and are looking for an opportunity to get into a winning startup in the earliest of days (less than 5 employees).
- Willingness to sign an NDA

If you are interested in this project, please reply with your prior experience and if chosen, we can hop on a Zoom to discuss further :)

Cheers,

title: Full Stack React/ Ruby on Rails Engineer
description:
Full-Stack Software Engineer (React/Ruby on Rails)

About Aidin
Our mission is to defragment the healthcare ecosystem with a seamless digital platform that transforms healthcare for good and improves outcomes for all. With Aidin’s platform, along with our development and design partners and a passionate full-time team of 5, we have successfully provided measurable impact and improved outcomes for 30 of the best health systems across the country, helping them to safely connect patients to the best next care provider.

At Aidin, we strive to be a “Teal” company, embracing pillars of trust, responsibility, accountability, compassion, openness, respect, and equality. We value impact over roles, growth and learning over failure, and results over statistics. We value expertise, but also recognize that we are more than the sum of our parts. Every employee has a direct impact on our product and success.

Our distributed team works 100% remotely on US Eastern Time, though we get together quarterly for team retreats.

We’re looking for a full-time, full-stack software engineer who is passionate about delivering value and providing solutions that improve the lives of our users and empower our client communities. We want people who take pride in designing, building, and maintaining the products they deliver, and are constantly seeking to master the skills that make this possible and learn new ones in the process.


Essential Responsibilities

As a full-stack engineer at Aidin, you will collaborate with other engineers, product managers, and UI/UX designers to innovate, improve, and maintain our product.

You will touch on every aspect of our technology stack, and your opinions and decisions will directly affect our technical direction.

You will assist and lead in making architecture decisions at a team and product level, with respect to the performance and security needs inherent in the healthcare industry.

You will assist and lead in the development of solutions from inception through delivery.

You'll be expected to learn and understand the architecture of our core product, consisting of a responsive Javascript Single-Page Application on the front end (using React), a RESTful API-based Ruby on Rails back end, and a PostgreSQL database.

You will use this knowledge to debug product issues and suggest improvements and optimizations. 

You will regularly review the code of your peers, upholding agreed-upon team standards.

You will be expected to thrive working both independently and alongside our extended team of developers of various skill sets and experience in an Agile environment.

Required Skills

Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, or a related discipline or graduate from a top bootcamp program 

4+ years of software development experience 

Proficiency in Ruby on Rails 4+, Javascript/React 16+, and SQL (PostgreSQL preferred) including professional experience

Experience with asynchronous programming patterns.

Ability to write scalable, maintainable code backed by quality unit tests and integration tests using tools such as RSpec, Jest, Cypress, or equivalent.

Collaborative coding experience, using tools like Github and JIRA

Strong communication experience with the ability to assist in aligning team, including non-technical members, on complex technical decisions


Nice-to-have skills

Experience with CI/CD platforms, such as CircleCI

Experience with other Javascript frameworks, such as Node.js

Experience in the healthcare sector or similar secure environment

Experience with design tools like Figma, Zeplin, or Invision, an eye for good design, or, at least, an eye for “this doesn’t look quite right…”.

Familiarity with Docker

Technical writing skills

Benefits
 - 100% remote work environment
 - Competitive salary with incentives
 - Comprehensive, flexible benefits, including 401k, health, dental, vision, and life insurance for you (full coverage) and your family (50% coverage).

Application Process
Going back to our core team values, we’re excited to have a new team member, not just a new employee. Our interview process is designed to be quick and collaborative:

Send us your “paperwork” – a resume and/or link to LinkedIn/Github/StackOverflow profile, along with a brief introduction and why you’re interested in working together. Start your cover letter with the word "Camden" 

Informal interview – let’s get to know each other a bit, and discuss expectations to see if there’s mutual interest.

Technical interview – we’ll check out a repo, review and scope some stories, and work through some issues together. We’re looking to understand how you like to work, while giving you a sense of the type of work we do. This is not a pointers and algorithms quiz, so don’t expect questions on obscure technical theory.

If we agree there’s a fit, you’ll have an offer within a week.

title: Firebase database restructuring
description:
Hi,

We are looking for some help to restructure our current firebase database, for our mobile app. We are developing a quiz app, and we have around 36,000 questions, that have text, images and mathematical equations. At present we have our data structured under 5 categories and 241 topics. We need to rearrange the questions into quizzes that have about 25 questions per topic (241 *25 = 1446 quizzes). You can write a script that can read each question and move it to the correct structure. Or you can propose any other alternate way to accomplish the requirement. You don't have to create any data. The request is just for restructuring existing data. 

I will be providing you the desired new structure, access to the current database and the new database structure. You can work with our developer to collaborate for any clarifications.

title: Need Android AND iOS Streaming App for Shoutcast Streams
description:
We currently have two Shoutcast streams being streamed from a server and we need a new mobile app that will allow users to listen to them via a mobile app, and also switch between the two streams. It also needs to be done for both iOS and Android.

We already have an existing app called FUNKEDUP on both platforms if you'd like to download it and also see what is already in place now with our existing app. Here's what we need.

- Develop a radio app that pulls the Shoutcast streams and allows users to switch between the two.
- Develop for both Android and iOS.
- Admin area to be able to insert ads.
- Each stream should display the album artwork, song title, and artist.
- Proper DCS to send that album, song, and artist data to Bluetooth devices like auto, etc.
- Each song should also have a "Buy Now" option that will link to Amazon with our affiliate ID in the URL.
- In App Browser for Website, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube, Mixcloud, and Soundcloud Page.
- Also link to be able to go to the store and Donate via Cash App, Venmo, or Paypal.
- Ability for users to request songs.
- Ability to send push notifications
- Upload both once they are completed.

The system we are using is using a CentovaCast and we can supply the tag attributes such as "buynow" links, "songrequest" tags, etc to help with some of that process. Including supplying access to the primary control panel.

There are obviously a lot of "minutia" that we haven't listed here and we're okay if a template is used, as long as we have the capabilities mentioned above. PLEASE download and check out our existing FUNKEDUP app to see what we're doing currently. It's fine if you delete it shortly afterward, but it's important that we maintain all of that functionality in this new app.

If you have examples of mobile apps you've developed prior, we would love to see them and it may sway our decision.

title: Senior Smart TV Tizen  WebOS  Developer
description:
OUR COMPANY
FreeCast Inc is a content discovery and management engine operating the world’s largest freely available Video-On-Demand (VOD) & Pay-per-view (PPV) library online
The FreeCast Network is delivered in the form of a media guide on all devices through SelectTV, a co-branded service for bandwidth distributors and device manufacturers

JOB DESCRIPTION
- Important stuff:
• Schedule: Full-time (~40-45h/week, min. 40h)
• Work hours: Monday-Friday, 8:30-9 AM to 5-5:30 PM EST
• Compensation: US$25.00/h
• Type: Contract (NDA required)

DESCRIPTION:
• We’re looking for a React Developer for our Tizen/WebOS Development Team
• You’ll be responsible for improvements, new features, and bug fixes on the SelectTV • Tizen and WebOS apps
• The ideal candidate has great communication skills, can multitask, is self-motivated, and works well in a team environment
• This person must have a passion for what they do, can organize responsibilities to identify and handle potential gaps and blockers to ensure that the tasks they and the team owners can be completed on schedule

REQUISITES

Mandatory:
• 3 years of experience with React
• Knowledgeable in object-oriented design
• Knowledgeable in working with REST and RPC APIs
• Knowledge of how to develop React apps on Tizen and/or WebOS

DESIRABLE:
• Familiar with the Git VCS
• Familiar with the Kanban and/or Scrum agile frameworks
• Familiar with Firebase
• Ability to multitask, organize, and prioritize work
• Ability to communicate effectively
• Experience working in a small-mid size team environment
• Ability to work effectively under time constraints
• Ability to quickly identify gaps, risks, and blockers
• Attention to detail
• Intermediate spoken English (you might be required to participate in weekly calls with the Development department)

PREFERRED:
• Deep familiarity with developing TV apps on Tizen
• Deep familiarity with developing TV apps on WebOS
• Advanced or fluent written and spoken English

PROCESS
• We’ll review your résumé and contact you within 7 days of receiving your application
• If selected, we’ll schedule a phone interview with you
• If you pass the first phase, we’ll give you a short take-home coding assignment
• If approved, you’ll be required to sign an NDA to begin employment on the following week
• E-mail in case you don’t receive a reply or you want to know about the status of your application: marcos@freecast.com

LEVEL
• Mid-Senior
• Senior

REPLY BY ANSWERING Interview Questions:

1. What are some of the primary differences between monolithic and microservice architectures, and which is a better option for flexibility and scalability?

2. What is the difference between synchronous and asynchronous programming, and how does asynchronous programming relate to your work with JavaScript?

3. How would you define functional programming? What is the role of functional programming in JavaScript?

4. How would you define one-way data flow and two-way data binding? What is the difference between the two?

title: Amazon Flex Block Grabber
description:
Looking for someone to develop the Amazon Flex Block Grabber . Please PM me if you have the experience of developing this block. Please DO NOT bid if you don't have the experience of building this bot.

You will need to install a proxy server onto a VPS. You will need to have this connect to the server to access the blocks for the Flex program/app. I need it to check for blocks between 10-20 times per second. Then when a block becomes available I would like it to be grabbed from the server to where a phone can accept it.

Features: 1. Having the ability to check Amazon Warehouse/Whole Foods/Prime locations every 5-10 seconds. faster = better
2. Must have the ability to filter the blocks based on locations, minimum time to arrive, minimum amount $, Offer Start time and Offer End time
3. Must have the ability to cancel the block once user click on cancel button
4. Must have the feature to control the speed and runtime



How does the Amazon Block sc**pt work?

The Block Grabber script is a simple script that runs on a computer. For a “production” server, the server should be extremely close to the Amazon Flex Blocks server, which is in an instance of AWS in Ashburn VA. The script logs into your Amazon Flex account, sends a command to check for blocks (the same as your refresh button on your app), decodes the block information, decides which ones to accept, then accept the specific block. All of this can occur within a few tenths of a second. In some warehouses, this process can be too long so additional scripting needs to be done in order to minimize computations and delays to beat out other scripts. Getting blocks in these warehouses can be impossible unless there are more blocks than sc**ts or that blocks come out last minute, preventing drivers that are not close by to accept them.

The Amazon Flex login information is not just a simple username and password. It is a digital key that is stored on your phone. You will need to set up your phone so that the internet is routed through a proxy server (your production server). The proxy server can then listen to the login command and capture the digital key. It can then be used by your script to log in. While your phone is linked to the proxy server, you can also check for blocks. The proxy server can output this information and show you what is being sent by your phone (refresh blocks) and what is sent by the Amazon Flex server (block information). Some people check this information daily to ensure that no changes are made. If your program responds with information formatted in an old way, Amazon could pick that up and detect that you are using a sc**pt.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
Janover Ventures (https://janover.ventures) is a fintech company building the nation's leading b2b platform for connecting commercial real estate borrowers with commercial lenders, democratizing a multi-trillion dollar universe. We're looking for someone to go to the moon with. Do you have a jet pack?

Opportunity

We are seeking **motivated** individuals to join us in building the future of commercial real estate technology. The ideal candidate will bring their own energy and ideas to the team. Candidates will be granted the freedom to own meaningful problems within our technology frameworks/systems, and seek to build modern architecture which is capable of scaling to the demands of the future. Some of our challenges today are:

1. The Vision Roadmap - we have some amazing initiatives, and the startup environment can be challenging, but the ideal candidate will learn, thrive, and deliver.
2. Innovate from Inception - the commercial real estate market is a massive opportunity, but everything we do will be groundbreaking since there’s no technology precedence on many of the challenges we face as a business. The ideal candidate will recognize, communicate, and help us build innovations.

Responsibilities

- Contribute to the successful development of our NoSQL data model, including taking advantage of modern features within our Data Mesh.
- Architect solutions:
    - Platform notifications
    - Platform communications (email/SMS/messaging)
    - Enterprise document management
    - Leverage cloud infrastructure & resources (eventing/storage/etl)
- Enhance DevOps/Release/Deployments, including documentation, within the Janover environments
- Be a leader within technology

Qualifications

- 5 – 10 years as a full-stack developer delivering production-quality web applications
- Strong understanding of:
    - Javascript and the Vue framework (Typescript)
    - modern API concepts, with a focus on GraphQL
    - developing Node.js backend systems
    - NoSQL concepts, MongoDB heavily preferred
- Comfortable operating public cloud infrastructure on **AWS**, Azure, or GCP

Personal Qualifications

- **Rockstar Quality**: We’re looking for a candidate who is naturally inquisitive and loves what they do. The ideal candidate will deliver world-class quality features, including exciting UX/UI designs.
- **Agile**: The ideal candidate will deliver meaningful contributions frequently, and report within an agile methodology.
- **Communicative**: We’re all here to learn as well as teach, and the ideal candidate will be a strong communicator across all the Janover teams. We’re always open to doing things better and we’re encouraged by confident change agents.

About Us

Janover Ventures is building the future of multifamily and commercial real estate finance. We believe that everyone should understand and have access to the most competitive loan terms and financial instruments... not just Wall Street big wigs! You will work with a dynamic, Earth-distributed team, and grow with an exciting company. There may be an opportunity to join a company equity-participation program. That's exciting!

Working with the Communications department, the WordPress Specialist will work on an ongoing basis to make content, technical, and security updates to the website. 

Responsibilities
- Regular maintenance to ensure website is secure and the site’s software is up to date 
- Content updates to site provided from staff
- Optimize and post new images provided by staff
- Manage WPForms plugin
- Emergency repairs due to hacker attacks
- Troubleshoot and resolve website problems
- Review site structure, web hosting, and server and suggest changes that would improve functionality
- Implement structural site changes if needed

Responsibilities
- Proficiency using WordPress
- Keen attention to detail 
- Design and UX Design skills is a plus
- Experience with responsive and adaptive design

This position is remote and works with a team that is temporarily remote during the COVID-19 pandemic. This is an hourly contractor position. Hours may vary depending on the time of year and scope of work.

Enterprise is an equal opportunity employer and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Chapter 12T of the San Francisco Administrative Code. Applicants will be required to provide written consent to a background check after receiving a conditional offer of employment.

Enterprise does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, ethnic background, religion, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, national origin, or disabilities. Please let us know if you need accommodations for the interview process.

title: Japanese Trading Company Website Conversion Rate Optimization (New Registration)
description:
Hello, We are an online trading platform.

The Japanese market is a valuable part of our business strategy already, and we are looking for a conversion rate specialist with experience in the Japanese market, who can help with optimizing our site for a better conversion among the Japanese customers. 

The task is to audit the Japanese version of our site and make conclusion of the following: What version of the site is more appealing to Japanese customers from the business perspective and why? 

What steps of the Japanese localisation for our site can you recommend? What improvements of the UX/UI design can be done in order to improve the conversion rate of the site? Are there any crucial mistakes that can affect the conversion rate? Are there any other recommendations that can be useful to optimize our site for the Japanese market? 

Can you share your opinion about the pricing at our site: what product at the site users will buy more likely (considering how the products and bundles are represented right now)? Is the difference between bundles obvious? 

How much time do you need to complete this job and write the report?
