title: Developer needed to update current 7.0 to 7.1 website
description:
This is a simple straightforward job. At this time, I am not looking for a lot of fancy coding. I really just want someone to get it put together for me quickly in a way that I can continue to tweak and modify over time as I grow.

Currently, I have a Squarespace website I built myself in 7.0 that I would like to update and convert to 7.1 with a new look and feel. 

I just finished working with a content writer to update my pages. I have a home page, about, contact, and three services pages. The content writer laid the content out in what I believe is called a wireframe. It is not fancy but gives great direction already.

I have a few website examples (that are also built-in Squarespace) that I could provide as examples of what I want my website to look like. I definitely think this is a job where you can just use a template—and add additional pages you want from other templates as 7.1 allows for that now. 

I've seen sites that have split-section functionality on some sites that I really like. I am not sure if that is part of any templates or a plugin but I may be interested in exploring that in my site. At least one of the examples I have includes this feature.

My contact page will need to connect with my Mailchimp. This is already set up on my current site. I would like to discuss if there is an option to have options on my contact page that may allow them to fill out different forms depending on what they are hiring me for. This may be a little more involved than what I am looking for at this time, but could perhaps be a separate project for you down the line. I also use Calendly would like to see if my calendar can easily be added to my contact page.

I need a few graphics for my home page to pair with my services: Leadership Development, Team Development, and Leadership Coaching. If you are a designer, you could create these—or you could use a template or Canva. The only thing about the latter choice is that I don't want it to be cheesy or too standard, and the images need to look like they belong together—the same look and feel. I've attached a document that I made using Canva images just to give an idea of the type of images that could connect to my different services.

I have a branding pdf, my logo, and a few images I can share with you. In some places I will probably use have you use placeholder photos that I will replace as I choose the final ones I want to go with.

I have a few SEO terms that I would like you to plugin for me. I don't know anything about SEO, backlinks, breadcrumbs. if that is a skill you have, I would be interested in learning more—maybe for this project, but absolutely for a future project.

I would like to get this done fairly quickly. So if you are really busy and not able to start for a few weeks, we are not a good match at this time. More than anything else, I just need to structure set up for me so that it is easy for me to go in and make updates and changes as I go.

Finally, I may like to communicate my ideas to you using Loom to create a short video. Due to a learning disability, this is a fast and easy way for me to communicate.

The purpose of this is to onboard the client and keep them engaged as opposed to emailing them documents after the fact.

The current developer that is unfortunately not available also had done an integration using single sign on with Zoho Desk and the Wordpress site. However, it was set up using this plugin

https://plugins.miniorange.com/wordpress-zoho-single-sign-on-sso-login

and it is set up incorrectly. Currently this would log you into Zoho Desk as an admin, however we want it for the end user (so when they log into our wordpress site, it also logs them into zoho desk so that in the event they go to the help center, it isn't asking them to log in).

I spoke with Zoho Desk and they said this can be achieved, just needs to be configured differently then we did it.

There is additional PHP / API work that is required within the logged in dashboard but I will review all of this with candidates.

title: BLE Sensor Connectivity to the Internet
description:
The project requires the creation of a BLE Hub gateway to connect BLE sensors to the internet combining WiFi, LTE, LoRa, Ethernet, BLE 5.2 with GPS location. 

The Hub will enable offload of sensor data and direct-to-Cloud (GCloud) data transfer. 

In brief, the project requires: 

1. Firmware programming for the Hub (LEWR840E5P or similar) to collect data from BLE beacons (already have those)
2. Optimise traffic for data upload to the cloud (e.g. data stored locally when connection to the cloud is down, then uploaded when connection is restored)
3. Set up multiple connectivity capabilities (WiFi, LTE - cellular, LoRa, Ethernet) as well as GPS

Optional: 
4. Software and database operations for interface with cross-platform app (phone and web)

title: Create a service portal for new client onboarding and document submission
description:
Work with an established vendor providing communication and commissary services to law enforcement and jail facilities to create a secure website that new clients will log into and complete onboarding documentation and software customization.  

Currently, documentation is manually provided to new clients that allows them to customize their financial details, commissary and vending needs for their inmates, as well as provide security requirements for communications services.  We would like to convert this process from spreadsheets and emailed documents into an interactive onboarding process.

Example of use: Upload a list of commissary items that are offered to our facilities, allow the administration to indicate what products that are not desired, notate if there are relative security groups, and provide any quantity per day limitations.  Detailed documentation of this process will be provided.

There will need to be an admin login as well as a customer facing portal so that we can monitor the client's progress, send email reminders, add additional information to be completed, reset tasks, and customize the overall process based on each individual facility's needs.

Detailed workflow and documentation details can be provided to qualified applicants for this job to allow for a more accurate quote.   Due to the sensitive nature of this documentation, it will not be provided until the applicant demonstrates relevant skill sets and reasonable baseline for a quote.  Examples of similar accomplished work is a plus.

A successful applicant may be asked to continue work on this project to expand the overall potential for long term use and possible integration with our in house software.

title: *Full-Time* Full Stack/Frontend Developer (MERN stack)
description:
Reporting To: Lead Developer
Department: Development
Location: Remote

Summary: Carthagos are looking for a talented Junior Developer to join our global Team. Our company develops fine-crafted web and mobile applications, and you'll be part of the driving force behind this mission. 

YOUR PROFILE

You are bold, methodical, and bright. You ally excellent communication skills with critical thinking and a team-driven way of working. As part of our Team, you'll have your ideas listened to, and your voice heard. We value ideas – and yours will always be welcome.

ABOUT US

We’re a global product studio that builds brands and applications for global startups. We've worked with 80 Global Brands and have already developed 2 Silicon Valley apps in the last 6 months. Our focus is the North American market, and our co-workers come from every part of the world. In Carthagos we believe in people. Beyond frontiers and backgrounds, we believe in talent and responsibility. We've been developing exciting apps and brand identities with this culture in mind, and we are passionate about excelling. Here, Creative, Development, and Management work closely to wow customers. Upon joining our Team, you'll be challenged to think in new ways and try new things.

At Carthagos, we combine creativity, data, media, and technology to bring our clients closer to their customers so they can spot new opportunities and achieve results that luck can’t explain. Our creative team dreams up ads and experiences that real people care about, talk about, and proudly share with others. And when we do it just right, it’s super fun and creates daring and clear-cut results for our clients.

You can check more our values and portfolio at [www.carthagos.com](http://www.carthagos.com). 

YOUR MISSION

We're looking for a skilled software developer to join our Team. Our company makes fine-crafted web and mobile applications, and you'll be part of the driving force behind our mission. As part of our Team, you'll work with autonomy. This role is full-time, which means 40 hours per week, in a flexible environment.

RESPONSABILITIES

Besides coding, we expect you to:

- Code Figma wireframes with great accuracy;
- Work in a multifunctional team structured around Agile principles;
- Share work status with Product Managers;
- Stay on delivery schedules;
- Attend Scrum meetings;
- Attend Weekly syncs to share ideas.

In addition to these daily responsibilities, you can expect to do these things sometimes:

- Talk to clients or stakeholders about your work and deliverables.

REQUIREMENTS

These are the things we're looking for filling this position:

- You have experience in React js, Javascript, HTML, CSS, and Redux.
- You have at least 1 year of experience
- You know how to clean, create reusable components, integrate api,,
- You have the desire for code and learn new things that will help you do this job well

In addition to the above, you will be one of our top candidates if.

- You are good at using Node js, Mongodb, cpanel, AWS, Webflow, Wordpress.
- You know how to work with Axios (or any other way to send and get HTTP requests)
- You have experience with Three js
- You have worked in Branding and Design-conscious Development agency.

COMPENSATION

We’re a forward-thinking, innovative organization that is continually looking for ways to invest in our people, practices, and technology. So you can expect: 

- A competitive base salary and a bonus structure with limitless growth potential;
- Internal growth opportunity;
- Continuous learning opportunities: here at Carthagos, we promote every team member’s continued growth, so you can enroll in one of the several courses from different learning platforms that we provide to thick and add to your knowledge and skills. Certificates included;
- The opportunity to work on fresh and inspiring projects that are generating a positive impact around the world;
- Training to set you up for success;
- Supportive and dynamic team environment: as we like to say, we are global, but we are familiar!

description:

We also have some basic scraping projects we need to get done.

It would be too difficult to try to explain the types and breadth of the work we need. Most of it is very basic. But some of it will require a lot of time and can be more complicated. We want all types of proposals. We have work for the right people at all levels of expertise in these fields. 

Our lowest level project would be something like this:

OR

Scraping reddit subreddits and exporting the information based on keywords to a database (or even a google sheet)

title: Backend developer - React / JS
description:
Hi, 

We are looking for one more backend developer to expand our current team of developers to speed up the process of building our new platform.

As we speak, we are already a few months in on working on our new platform. The platform is going to replace our current website https://uwassistent.nl/ 

The main purpose of the new platform is: 
To go from a simple website with forms to request a service to a complete self-booking system. Instead of having to fill in a form to request one of the services that we offer (cleaner, handyman, gardener, babysitter) and that the customer service employees manually have to find a match with the correct service provider. 
We are now creating a platform where you can select your own service providers and make a match immediately. So that we as a platform are just providing you with the service to find a service provider with ease. 

We have completed our first platform and it has been running stable for the last two years. This second new platform is aimed at different target group and has some different features. 

Preview / to get a better idea
To get a better idea of what it will look like, have a look at: https://hlprs.nl/en
and fill in the form in the banner. (Zipcode: 1012 AB ) and choose a service type. This is our already operating first platform.  
 
Stack:
React
JS

Node.JS (backend)
Hosting on Soyoustart
Postgres database
GraphQL

Thanks for reading till here and don’t wait to send me a message if you think you can do this job. Of if you want to have more information, please send me a message as well. 

Kind regards,

Geert

title: Web Development WordPress Site
description:
TrialLine.net is an interactive timeline tool for attorneys. Attorneys use TrialLine to make presentations about their cases to their staff, judges, and juries.

We are resigning trialline.net. The current issue technical is that TrialLine.net is a single page which is also attached to the TrialLine applications. To work around this, we have been posting additional content and tutorials to blog.trialline.net. What we want to do now is move the trialline app to app.trialline.net and install a wordpress site at TrialLine.net. Then we will take the content from blog.trialline.net and combine (and SEO redirect) it with the new wordpress site at trialline.net. That will allow us to work on the website and the app separately, without and code crossover. The design of blog.trialline.net is terrible. We are NOT trying to recreate that look, but rather update it via the Template Monster link. We want trialline.net and the blog pages to all have the same look and design.

We need a developer who can take this template: https://bit.ly/3zm2Aqf , install it on their own temporary server space, do the redesign work, and then allow us to copy and move over when we have moved the app to the new URL and are ready to deploy the new TrialLine.net. As you can see, this template has a lot of nice movement in the header. We will create some of our own custom images for this, but we would like someone who has experience creating this kind of movement and interactiveness. One of our big goals is to use creative movements in the design to draw people in to the interactiveness of our timelines. You can see samples of our interactive timelines here: https://trialline.net/sample-triallines#samples_holder - It is important to us that the person we hire have some great ideas on how to bring our product, movement, and design into the new homepage design.

In addition to the design work, we will need new contact forms created and incorporated into our Zoho.com CRM. These forms will be requests for live demos and requests to be added to our email marketing or newsletter lists. Further, we would like to hire someone now who we can continue to have a relationship with for future design support.
Let us know turnaround time and expected costs. We would love to have the project complete by April. Please provide sample URLs of similar work. Please also confirm you can make the desktop design mobile ready and that you understand principles of SEO for the URL redirects and access files.

Thank you

title: ReTool CRM Programmer
description:
Thank you for checking out our listing!

We are an e-commerce business that sells golf cart parts and accessories known as Golf Cart Garage. To learn more about us, please visit our website www .golfcartgarage.com. 

We are looking for a Retool CRM Programmer that has previous experience with programing using Retool. In order to be considered for the project, you must have done this sort of work before.

We need assistance with the research, design, and implementation of a consolidated customer data portal in ReTool.

Project Objectives:

Consolidate available data from relevant, customer-focused data sources.
Provide a graphical user interface that empowers our employees with easy access to a consolidated view of the data.
Create a mechanism to write customer service notes to customer profiles in existing systems.
Perform quality assurance on the data, document processes, and provide any necessary training to Golf Cart Garage.

The success of this project will be determined by the following:


Golf Cart Garage has a graphical user interface where we can access customer profiles encompassing all of the agreed data sources.
The Golf Cart Garage database is regularly and reliably updated with the most recent information.

Responsibilities:

Set up a database and extract-transform-load process to consolidate data from the following platforms: BigCommerce, Klaviyo, Dial Pad, and HelpScout.
Develop an intuitive GUI and the necessary queries for accessing database views using ReTool.
Create a mechanism in the GUI for Golf Cart Garage to feed customer notes back into either BigCommerce or Klaviyo.
Ongoing monitoring/maintenance following launch.
Regularly communicate any updates by email or phone.

The intended value of this project is to improve the efficiency of our business and the quality of life of our employees and increase productivity elsewhere by reducing the amount of time spent searching for this information.


This is a one-time project, but we may need ongoing maintenance periodically in the future. Compensation will be $20.00/hr.

Please submit your application and verifiable proof of experience in order to be considered for the project.

Thank you!

-Dan

title: Theater Website Scraper via Scrapy

I run a small service that pulls show listings for comedy shows using scrapy. I have a few websites that need to have scrapers written to pull show data. Once written, I can integrate them into the existing system. I’m happy to provide some of the existing scrapers to assist in structuring.

The websites are:

https://thepit-nyc.com/events/
https://www.hideouttheatre.com/calendar/
https://improv.com/hollywood/calendar/

From each website, I need to pull the following information for each show:

Title
Date (formatted YYYY-MM-DD @ HH:MM pm)
Date (epoch time)
Image/Poster*
Description*
Cost of show*
Venue/Stage within the theatre (some theaters have multiple stages within them)*
URL of page

*represents optional data that may not be available for every show.

These are just the first theatres I’d like to start with. I have about two dozen more theatres that I’d be interested in using your services for if this goes well. I’m interested in what you estimate the cost will be to complete the scrapers for the theatres listed above.

I use Python 2.7 and Scrapy 1.8.0.

Happy to answer any questions.

title: Create a PDF Editor for a Notary Platform
description:
I am looking for a programmer to develop a PDF editor for a Notary Public website.  The editor is one part of a platform under development that will provide notary services online.     

PLEASE DO NOT BID ON THIS PROJECT IF YOU HAVE NOT  READ IT COMPLETELY AND ARE PREPARED TO DISCUSS THE PROGRAMMING SKILLS NECESSARY TO COMPLETE THE ASSIGNMENT.   

We already have much of the platform complete including user, notary and client registration, document uploads, id verification and KBA, payment processing,  Digital signature creation, X.509 certificate creation, and document delivery.    

The editor will access information from a MySQL database before the editing session starts to get user and document information for the editing session.   

Editing feature will allow for applying a signature, adding a notary stamp, adding text and checkmarks. If possible, I would like a “white-out” feature so I can overwrite areas of a document. The software will be used in a WEBEX or ZOOM meeting so the notary can notarize the signature with one or multiple signers. I do NOT need character recognition. The original document will not be changed – just new elements added to the document.

Multiple Documents: Must be able to edit a single document or package of multiple documents Document Storage: Documents will be stored in Dropbox. Future development will store documents in a stand-alone server linked to an SQL database. For editing, the documents will be retrieve from Dropbox and returned to the same folder marked complete.

Tagging: Prior to the meeting, the notary must “tag” the document with flags to indicate where signatures, stamps and text are needed. The tags will be links in the document during the notary sessions, so the signatures and text can be added easily.

Tags should be assigned to the notary or a signer so only the appropriate person can place the signature on the document. The tags must be color=coded to indicate the appropriate user.

Signature: The user should be able to upload a signature via PDF or add a text based signature. The signature file can be stored in DROPBOX.

Digital Certificate: Each signer must be assigned a digital certificate. When the final document is complete, any view should be able to click on a signature in the document a see the basic certificate information. 

Collaborative Editing: Each user must open the document on their own computer. The notary should be able to control who can add elements to the document. The notary will select a user, direct them to place their signature or text, then the notary will switch the control to the next user. (up to 10 signers plus the notary)

The issue we have had with this in the past was server load on showing changes to the documents. We only need changes to be shared on a mouse-click on Enter key. I don’t need every screen to update on every key stroke. The server load would be a major drag.

Audit Trail – The program must create a second PDF document with the same name + “.audit”. This document will log when stamps and signatures are placed. The log will contain the signer name, item placed, date and time. The signer will one be able to place one type of item – a signature – but it will be placed multiple time and will be logged on each one. The notary will be able to place either a signature or stamp and the log must indicate which.

Notary Log – After the WEBEX session is complete, the notary must add an entry to his electronic notary log. The log will also be on DropBox but will eventually be moved to a SQL database. The log will record: Signers name, ID type, Type of signing, date and time. This info will eventually be pulled from a database, but for now, the notary will enter in manually.

The web platform that is being created by my development team already includes notary and signer sign up, calendar management, document management, ID verification and authentication, billing, and document delivery. We have been under development for many months.

We had another freelance developer working on this, but he disappeared before the project was complete. We don’t have any of his work.

title: ReactJS  developer needed to make a web site front end (to existing back end) using WebSockets
description:
TelXL Limited is a telecommunications company that provides phone call routing and other services to call centres.  It main user interface for administration and for call centre agents to use is outdated and in need of a refresh.

An example of this user interface is a screen (web page) where a call centre agent has areas of their display (widgets) for controlling their phone calls, another for setting their status, another for sending internal messages and so on.  The attached screenshot is an example of this.

The back-end systems that send and receive information to these widgets already exists and takes the form of a WebSocket and some standardised JSON messages.  

This project is to provide a web site front end framework where:

 1) The front end framework establishes and maintains a WebSocket connection to our back-end servers.
 2) Our JSON messages can be sent and received over this websocket.
 3) One of a set of pre-configured display grid arrangements is laid out on the screen.
 4) The framework will allow "widgets" to be positioned in these grid panels.  Note that the design and details of individual widgets is NOT part of this project.  
 5) You will provide an example of at least one widget, likely one that set/shows the call centre agent's status, as a demonstration of the communication methods.
 6) That demonstration widget will show how the display of the widget can be updated upon the event of receiving a message addressed to it over the websocket (e.g. information about a change in status)
 7) That demonstration widget will show how clicking a button or taking some other action on the widget can result in a suitable message being sent down the websocket.
 8) You will provide details (using examples of the widget(s) described above) of how our in-house web designers/developers can create further widgets.
 9) The grid that these widgets sit inside must allow us to pre-configure multiple grid layouts.
 10) These grid layouts must be responsive to changes in browser/screen layout, such as mobile phone screen shape and rotation, with well defined rules about which parts of the grid are shown/hidden or re-positioned as the layout is forced to change.
 11) In the event of a WebSocket disconnection, or a lack of data coming over it (a "ping" should arrive every 30 seconds), the application should alert the user of a problem.

title: Flutter developer needed to build a match making app
description:
Based in Dubai, I want to launch a mobile app (Android & iOS) providing professional match-making.
I have basic knowledge of Flutter but want to hire an experienced developer to increase quality and time-to-market, while I'll focus on product and marketing.
Screens are currently being designed in Figma by a UX/UI designer...

Key technical requirements:
- Firestore as database, functionally comparable to a social/chat app (filter profiles on structured criteria, send messages to selected profiles...)
- Firestore authentication (anonymous + SMS and FB/Google/Linkedin)
- video upload/play: capture/upload a video to encode before uploading to cloud storage, play videos stored on cloud storage
-- use of Google Voice API to generate transcript of videos to ensure no contact details are shared
- in app-purchase, to charge when a member wants to meet a matching profile
- web integration with deeplink: app should also work on Web, at least to show profile from url and point to deferred deeplink (to show in first app-scren after install the profile which generated the install...)

title: Wordpress Development  / HTML/CSS/Javascript
description:
I have 2 CSV files containing a list of:
- Courses (course names, descriptions, thumbnail)
- Course instructors (names, description, thumbnail)

There are around 150,000 total courses/instructors.

I would like to deploy a Wordpress website consisting of: 1 Home page, many Course Pages, and many Instructors pages.

There is no need for any additional navigational pages. These course and instructor pages will function as 'landing pages' and will be used for a Google Ads campaign.

I would like 3 different designs made for the Courses page. The design will change based on URL paramater. For example, cheapcourses.net/python-course-by-george-michael/?var=a would show one design. Changing ?var= to ?var=b would show the second design, and ?var=c would show the third design. The same 3 design approach is needed for the instructor page.

So that's 6 page designs in total. These pages will be made by you in Elementor. I will be on a call with you as we set these up. I want you to spend no more than 30-45 minutes on each page. Basically I'm looking for VERY simplistic designs that contain a vew elements like Headline, Call to action button, and description.

If this project goes well, I will have many more projects for you in the future! I'm a serious employer with well over $20k spent on UpWork.

title: QA Engineer SDET
description:
QA Engineer SDET — Mid/Senior

About the Job
The International team is looking for a Test engineer to help build out and discover new ways of
creating and executing tests. This is an exciting opportunity to work with a small, collaborative
team of engineers, product managers, and designers that want to provide value to our
international users.
The International team is responsible for all international development efforts including
launching new markets/countries as well as growing our 22 existing non-US sites.
A typical week includes working with fellow Engineers and Product Managers to understand the
requirements, automate features and support Glassdoor’s business goals. By providing
guidance on testing methodologies, you will help keep the entire team accountable for the
quality of work released.
Finally, you will push new efficiencies with your team, from promoting test coverage to creating
new tools and evangelizing automation best practices.

Must Skills:
● Proficient with programming/scripting languages such as Java, JavaScript, Python, etc.
● Experience with Selenium or any other UI automation tool.
● Solid experience with CI/CD for automated tests
● Solid experience automation test cases (unit, e2e, integration, performance, etc)
● Experience with software development life-cycle and Agile methodologies
● Able to communicate effectively with fellow developers about quality related needs
● Self-starter who is comfortable taking a task and delivering on it, without management
● Fast learner, strong technical chops and passion for your work with an “Up For A Challenge”
attitude
● Experience with international and localization testing is a plus!
Responsibilities:
QE experienced various automation frameworks, a strong understanding of QA standard
methodologies, and a passion for quality. Object oriented programming experience is also a
necessity.
In this role you work in a cross-functional, collaborative environment – so excellent interpersonal
and communication skills are a must. And most importantly – we look for people who can
prioritize, multi-task, and deliver.

title: Outlook Addin Developer
description:
Develop Outlook Add-ins based on web-based platform. Please note that Outlook add-ins are different from COM or VSTO add-ins, which are older integrations specific to Outlook running on Windows. Unlike COM add-ins, Outlook add-ins don't have any code physically installed on the user's device or Outlook client. For an Outlook add-in, Outlook reads the manifest and hooks up the specified controls in the UI, and then loads the JavaScript and HTML.
Need senior developer who has developed Outlook Add-ins based on web-based platform.

title: IOS app development for watch app
description:
Hi There,

I am looking for someone who will be able to create an IOS app for my business. The app will be about watches. I want it to be a sort of community app which teaches people more about watches. People have a personal account in which they have all of their own information, ex. favorites.

I have made a couple of designs of how I would like it to appear. For this I will need a couple of features. 
This includes the following: 

A home screen with all of the features mentioned below, with easy access to all of the features.

A catalog with different watch brands and watches within those brands, which I am able to add and edit myself.

A daily watch tab, this sends out a notification to the user. The notification message will say something like ”Get to know this watch now!”. Once clicked, the user will be brought to a new random(based on their choose of favorites) watch page where they can learn something about the watch. Once a user has read the daily watch, they will be able to tap something like ”Learned” which will save the watch to a “knowledge catalog”. This will make sure the app will not show this watch again.

A news tab, just a simple but functional news page with articles that I am able to upload myself.

A market tab, in which users can track the current value of watches.

When the user starts the app for the first time, they can choose their favorite brands in their account. The app will only show a daily watch based on the user's favorites.

The app is supposed to be free to download with in-app purchases. I will explain this later since this is not a main focus at this point.

At last I would like an admin app/function in which only I can add things to the app like new watches and news articles.

Please let me know if you are able to do this and what your quotation would be. I am open to all suggestions and feedback. If you are interested in my designs I will be happy to send them to you.

Looking forward to be hearing from you!

Kind Regards,

Danilo

I’m a lawyer who’s dedicated my career to working to end homelessness in the US, and founder of an organization dedicated to this mission. I recently stepped down from leading the organization to focus on writing a book on the topic. I need to set up a personal website to showcase my work and expertise, build my audience and, eventually, promote my book.

I own a domain name, mariafoscarinis.com, but I am otherwise a total novice. I am interested in Wix and Square space, which I understand will be easy for me to update, but also open to ideas, including using Google. I would like to meet immediate goals by March 11. If we work together well I am open to considering a longer term engagement.

My immediate goal is to:
—Design and build a basic website that can grow and that I can easily edit and update myself

I know I will need:
—advice on design. I have ideas for landing page text.
—I know I will need links to: 
—my publications
—some of my media coverage
—my social media
—organizations I like
—relevant news items

Critical skills:
Ability to communicate clearly and to exchange ideas
Ability to meet deadlines
Technical skill to build a simple website that can grow 
Design and branding skill
Ability to advise me on design and branding
Willingness to agree on a project budget in advance

title: Experienced Java/Angular developer needed
description:
We are seeking an experienced full stack developer to join our existing project team.

This is a 3-6 month engagement.

You will work as part of a small project team to trouble-shoot, improve and deliver feature enhancements to an existing web-based hospitality platform.

You will apply your understanding of both frontend and backend programming languages coupled with your proven business logic to solve issues and continually improve the platform both in terms of functionality but also in respect to user experience.

We adopt an agile methodology, working in self-managed teams and collaborating closely with our Clients. 

You will get to work alongside highly motivated and technically gifted colleagues and interesting Clients allowing you to expand your skill-set whilst also imparting your knowledge to the wider team.

Fluent English is important.

This will be a full time / 5 days per week. You should expect to work 30-40 hours per week, as close to UK business hours as possbile.

•	You will be passionate about technology with a curious mind, constantly growing your technical expertise both within and outside the working environment learning from and sharing your expertise with others.

•	You will have solid experience building software products and helping to shape solutions to meet the needs of Clients. 

•	We expect you to have core expertise with front-end technologies and practices to include Angular, Javascript, TypeScript, HTML/CSS3/SASS, Webpack, Material Design. 

•	Back-end wise you will have expertise with JAVA language and related frameworks. 

•	You will also have working experience of Testing Frameworks such as Groovy, Spock, Wiremock  and SQL and NoSQL systems.


Additionally you will have
o	Experience with Firebase
o	Knowledge of cloud technologies (AWS and/or Azure)
o	Familiarity with CI/ CD workflower e.g. Jenkins, Circle CI, Bitbucket pipelines etc
o	Be proficient in writing and tuning SQL queries 

Whilst it is the nature of your experience that will be of most interest to us, we have found that typically someone will have needed ~6 years relevant working experience to have the gained the tools, skills and knowledge needed to perform this role.

title: WooCommerce/Shopify custom product plugin for photo frames
description:
PLEASE READ CAREFULLY!

Hello all,

Looking for an experienced web developer with ecommerce background specializing in building custom web-to-print plug-ins for either Shopify or WooCommerce.

As I don't have an existing website yet, I don't have a preference for either platforms but I'm leaning towards Shopify.

This job is to develop a plug-in that enables users to choose from different product types and upload photos to preview them before placing the order.

There are 3 different product types with slightly different UX (Page 1):
1. Square photo frames:
Square photo frames have fixed orientation but also have different styles (variants)

2. Rectangular photo frames:
Very similar to square frames but they can have either one of two orientations: Portrait and landscape. Choosing an orientation changes the appearance of the frame and the cropping window shape.

3. Collages:
Collages are special because they come in preset configuration of both square and rectangle in any number of arrangements but they don't offer the same flexibility such as changing number of frames or changing the style.

Plugin features:
1. Multiple photo selection: Users can select and upload multiple photos at once, resulting in corresponding number of photo frames (Page 4).
2. Pre-cart live price calculation (Page 5).
3. Ability to change selected frame style (for rectangle and square frames) (Page 6).
4. Some frame styles have different photo placeholder (Page 6).
5. Photo quality checks: we'll conduct photo quality check two times, one when uploading the photo and one when the user crops it to fit in frame (Page 8).
6. Incentivize users to add more product (i.e. buy 2 more and get x% off) (Page 9).
7. Supports major photo file types including (.heic).
8. When the user finishes choosing and editing their selection, show an alert that they've made the adjustments to their satisfaction.
9. Low resolution photos should be flagged.
10. RTL language support (Arabic).

Considerations that require clarification:
1. Because each product type and style combination is a different 'variant', how do we integrate them with either Shopify or Woo products tab?
2. Can we easily track stock status for each variant and maybe hide those out of stock from user selection?
3. Is adding different variants as easy as typically adding products?
4. How to adjust image place holder for different frame types and styles?
5. On the dashboard and after the user places an order, How do you include user photos and selected frame types/styles?
6. Do custom frame thumbs show in cart &  on checkout?


Deliverables:
1. Mobile friendly, basic webstore with support for multiple currencies and Arabic language*.
2. Fully functional plug-in according to documentation.
3. Products setup & upload.
4. Full source code pushed to our repo.
5. Entire project published to our customer facing webstore within set time frame.
* I'm not asking for website design.

I'd like to hear your thoughts specially on the 'considerations' section. and please take a look at the attached document and if you have any questions shoot away.

P.s We'll discuss milestones before hiring.

Thanks,
Amin

title: Color palette generator Chrome extension
description:
Hello,
 We are looking to develop a Google Chrome plugin to support the work of graphic designers. The plugin will identify colors visible on a webpage and translate that into RGB codes. Ideally we would like to create files of color pallets and store them in the cloud.
 Deliverables:
1. Be able to create accounts for the program using email and password
2. Access to the extension with an UI via extension toolbar, and right click action on any website
3. Separate the text colors, store text colors as a separate color theme or remove from the color palette of the website
4. Choose 5 major colors by frequency and/or the size of the color block in a website by scanning the css file vs. scanning the full page after it has been rendered 
5. Display the five color swatches (square color blocks)
6. Display the RGB code and the percentage of usage in the website of the 5 colors when hovered over the swatches in the extension toolbar UI
7. Store the palette in the user’s local library with the website name associated (e.g. Color palette of amazon.com)
8. Functionality to create cloud-based collaborative projects where participants can add the palettes from their user library

description:
A Little Bit About Us:

We are a growing global technology company that is looking to reinvent the way organizations build Trust in People with technology and AI-backed background checks. We are proud to share that we recently secured 43 million in funding, were named one of Canada’s Companies-to-Watch in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ Awards, and are on track to become one of Canada’s fastest-growing start-ups. 

Who are Certonians?

We are soccer players, DIY creators, spicy-food lovers, karaoke lovers, wine connoisseurs, and so much more! We are a team of 150+ people currently living the dream at Certn and are looking for more team members to level us up. If you are excited about working with a group that values accountability, working synergistically with one another, being inclusive of different perspectives, and not being an asshole - aka approaching all solutions & problems with compassion and empathy - we want to hear from you!

This Opportunity:

We are looking for a Senior Full-stack Developer to expand our growing Engineering team! Reporting to our Engineering Team Lead, you will be responsible for helping maintain and expand on our web applications, building features, evolving practices and procedures, and mentoring Junior Developers.

Success in the role requires someone who is a complex problem solver, all-star collaborator, and has the desire to mentor growing developers.

As our Senior Full Stack Developer, you will:
Provide technical mentorship to teammates through coaching and paired coding.
Maintain high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits.
- Engage in technical discussion of new solutions and architectures.
- Encourage innovation and foster an environment of continuous improvement.
- Ensure that technical decisions support our goals of quality, performance, scalability, reliability, availability, and security.
- Build new features with a focus on testability and extensibility.

We are hoping you bring:
- Proven success developing and releasing large scale applications using React  
- Highly proficient and experienced developing and testing on the frontend with JavaScript and associated technologies (CSS/HTML, modern frameworks)
- Hands-on experience working with Python and Django, or a similar web framework
- An understanding of SQL and relational database design, Postgres experience preferred
- An understanding of cloud platforms and experience deploying on AWS
- Knowledge of principles for effective software development, and experience applying these principles in a team context to result in accessible and maintainable code
- An understanding of asynchronous programming, JSON Web APIs, Jenkins, Django Rest Framework, Linux
- A collaborative approach towards problem-solving; you have experience communicating perspectives on suggested improvements in a team context and advocating for the best solution 
- Experience with and desire to leave things better than you found them - advocating for improvements to the team’s practices, processes, and tools, to help us reliably deliver quality results

Benefits
Our goal is to make sure Certn to be the best place for you to work. That means we are consistently asking for your feedback, researching best practices, and implementing new programs and changes in the way we work so that we can each walk away every day feeling proud to work here!

title: *Full-Time* Full Stack/Frontend Developer (MERN stack)
description:
Reporting To: Lead Developer
Department: Development
Location: Remote

Summary: Carthagos are looking for a talented Junior Developer to join our global Team. Our company develops fine-crafted web and mobile applications, and you'll be part of the driving force behind this mission. 

YOUR PROFILE

You are bold, methodical, and bright. You ally excellent communication skills with critical thinking and a team-driven way of working. As part of our Team, you'll have your ideas listened to, and your voice heard. We value ideas – and yours will always be welcome.

ABOUT US

We’re a global product studio that builds brands and applications for global startups. We've worked with 80 Global Brands and have already developed 2 Silicon Valley apps in the last 6 months. Our focus is the North American market, and our co-workers come from every part of the world. In Carthagos we believe in people. Beyond frontiers and backgrounds, we believe in talent and responsibility. We've been developing exciting apps and brand identities with this culture in mind, and we are passionate about excelling. Here, Creative, Development, and Management work closely to wow customers. Upon joining our Team, you'll be challenged to think in new ways and try new things.

At Carthagos, we combine creativity, data, media, and technology to bring our clients closer to their customers so they can spot new opportunities and achieve results that luck can’t explain. Our creative team dreams up ads and experiences that real people care about, talk about, and proudly share with others. And when we do it just right, it’s super fun and creates daring and clear-cut results for our clients.

You can check more our values and portfolio at [www.carthagos.com](http://www.carthagos.com). 

YOUR MISSION

We're looking for a skilled software developer to join our Team. Our company makes fine-crafted web and mobile applications, and you'll be part of the driving force behind our mission. As part of our Team, you'll work with autonomy. This role is full-time, which means 40 hours per week, in a flexible environment.

RESPONSABILITIES

Besides coding, we expect you to:

- Code Figma wireframes with great accuracy;
- Work in a multifunctional team structured around Agile principles;
- Share work status with Product Managers;
- Stay on delivery schedules;
- Attend Scrum meetings;
- Attend Weekly syncs to share ideas.

In addition to these daily responsibilities, you can expect to do these things sometimes:

- Talk to clients or stakeholders about your work and deliverables.

REQUIREMENTS

These are the things we're looking for filling this position:

- You have experience in React js, Javascript, HTML, CSS, and Redux.
- You have at least 1 year of experience
- You know how to clean, create reusable components, integrate api,,
- You have the desire for code and learn new things that will help you do this job well

In addition to the above, you will be one of our top candidates if.

- You are good at using Node js, Mongodb, cpanel, AWS, Webflow, Wordpress.
- You know how to work with Axios (or any other way to send and get HTTP requests)
- You have experience with Three js
- You have worked in Branding and Design-conscious Development agency.

COMPENSATION

We’re a forward-thinking, innovative organization that is continually looking for ways to invest in our people, practices, and technology. So you can expect: 

- A competitive base salary and a bonus structure with limitless growth potential;
- Internal growth opportunity;
- Continuous learning opportunities: here at Carthagos, we promote every team member’s continued growth, so you can enroll in one of the several courses from different learning platforms that we provide to thick and add to your knowledge and skills. Certificates included;
- The opportunity to work on fresh and inspiring projects that are generating a positive impact around the world;
- Training to set you up for success;
- Supportive and dynamic team environment: as we like to say, we are global, but we are familiar!

title: Backend Developer for Sports-Tech Mobile Game
description:
Czech sports/tech/gaming startup Live Penalty is looking for an experienced Backend Developer for our mobile game (in cooperation with STRV).

Live Penalty is a mobile game that connects the real world of football/soccer with the digital world of eSports. Digital gamers can use their devices to control a physical ball launcher and compete in real penalty shootouts against professional goalkeepers.

Exclusive, live-hosted penalty shootout events with top athletes, influencers, and brands in prime locations invite gamers to participate. Single and multiplayer modes challenge gamers to pass multiple rounds of the elimination game until one finalist remains for a true 1on1 interaction with the real goalkeeper and a chance to win high rewards.

A video database of pre-recorded athlete performances allows gamers to play the game and improve their skills 24/7. Individual user profiles include different challenges and track the gamer’s progress while collecting goals, points, and other rewards.

Our technical stack
- Languages: Typescript/JavaScript (Node.js)
- Framework: Koa, Express
- Cloud: Heroku, AWS
- Databases: Postgres, Firestore, Redis, ElasticSearch
- Containers: Docker
- Continuous integration: Github Actions

Perks & Benefits*
- Access to STRV’s award-winning shared office space in Prague 8, terrace, event space, relaxing zones, and a barbecue grill
- Free snacks and fruits, free lunch on Mondays, and breakfasts on Fridays
- Xbox, foosball, pool table and ping-pong
- Rooftop bar to chill out during the day and party at night (free beer on tap)!
- Well-equipped gym and many sport classes
- No office hours and no micro-management
- Home-office / Remote work option
- International team/project


About you
- You are an experienced Backend Developer with a solid background in Node.js, and you are able to design and develop RESTful services.
- You have experience with at least one relational and one no-SQL database.
- Experience in other backend languages is a huge plus. Especially: C# .NET, Golang, Python.
- Any experience with low latency video streaming or VOD will be highly appreciated.
- You are able to manage yourself and your work on the project as well.
- Experience with game development
Optional/Preferred:
- A deeper insight into the world of football and its respective eSports field

title: In need of Web UI/UX Designers
description:
We are a US-Based company that provides web design and development services to business owners. These are typically E-commerce or service businesses. We are looking for **designers who are proficient in the Adobe Creative Suite**, and who specifically **have experience with creating web design mockups/previews** inside of photoshop or Adobe XD.

You will be expected to provide a design mockup/preview based on a theme that is chosen. This mockup will reflect client needs and requests, and will require iterations until the client is satisfied. You will then assign all assets to be exported so that a development team can take over and develop the site based on your mockup.

This is a team-oriented company, and we love to grow and aspire to become the best version of ourselves! Please apply if you match the following:

**Skills Required:**

- 2+ Years of Web Design experience
- Basic understanding of Wordpress and how themes are used.
- Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Adobe XD, Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator).
- Awareness of good UI/UX principles.
- Awareness of good site structure from a marketing strategy perspective
- Able to manipulate images, edit, and remove subjects from the background.
- Basic understanding of Search Engine Optimization principles

**Other Requirements:**

- A portfolio or list to show your work (you will be immediately denied if you have no display of previous work.)
- Basic understanding of wordpress “drag-and-drop”/”WISIWIG” builders (like Elementor, DIVI, Beaver Builder, etc) and the limitations they sometimes present.
- Willing to work with a team
- Willingness to accept critique and make revisions based on feedback
- Ability to work on multiple projects and complete projects in a timely manner
- Willingness to learn and a desire to grow in your profession
- We prefer applicants from the Philippines

**Ideal, but not at all required:**

- Have worked and designed with Wordpress “drag-and-drop”/”WISIWIG” builders.
- Know basic HTML and CSS
- Can fully design in Adobe XD and then develop it in Wordpress theme.

## Details

Shift: 11 PM to 8 AM Philippine Time

Rate: $XX USD per hour

Direct Manager:

Closely Collaborate with:

if 2nd candle also same then place one more order and if 2nd candle go agenest   us then close all buy and wait for move next 100PIPS if its go to down then place sell.
whatever side is moving you have to follow that.
every time before place a order you have to close all opposite side order ( if you want to place a buy then close all sell if you want to sell close all buy)

new candle (46177) start so we wait to go up 100pips when market go to (46277) its place buy order

all order is close in (xx) or when go down (xx)

if 1st order is 0.01 2nd order also same 3rd order 0.02 4th 0.04 5th 0.08
after 3rd order it will multiply last order value.

after place each order set SL (200PIPS) TP (300PIPS) and keep updating TP by checking candle also keep update SL by checking candle. remember we lose each order 100pips not more then that cause when a market move and go 100IPS we place order only that and close all opposite side order.

title: Unreal Engine 4.27 | Assistant Coder
description:
We are looking for an experienced developer with Epic's Unreal Engine 4.27 to assist our existing team's workload in completing an online multiplayer action game, and related game spin-offs.

While this is a temporary assignment at the moment, it may well open the opportunity for something far more permanent later on, for the right candidate...

About us...

- we work with the Github repository for code maintenance and check-in/check-out, forks and merges and it will be better if you have also experience of working in this environment.
- we use Maya and Blender created 3D models, together with custom maps / levels, and you will need to be able to integrate these with the game engine, and feedback any issues to the rest of the team so they can be fixed.
- while we generally script game functions ourselves, we also make use of available assets from third parties, that may therefore need integrating.
- our team works remotely from a number of time zones, and natively speaks a number of languages, but for work we all use English (written, not spoken) so you must have at least a reasonable understanding of this.

So, are you the right fit for this job?

- are you able to work to tight deadlines?
- do you have a passion for game programming and the skills to back it up?
- do you have experience with code and asset integration to a game?
- are you a problem solver with a can-do attitude?
- are you organised, detail oriented and able to keep meaningful records of the work done and in progress? (we use a web-based project management system to organise specific tasks, in addition to Upwork for more general things and job payment)
- if coding, do you create clean and well commented work?
- are you able to communicate clearly and timely with other team members?

So, what is the work exactly? Typical tasks may include:

- integrating or creating code for specific in-game functions or features...
- bug fixing and QA of code and game logic...
- tuning and playability enhancements (weapons / damage, inventories, chaos destruction, blueprints. actor animation integration and adjustment, etc)...
- assisting other game developers with issues that arise for them...

title: Create HTML for transactional E-mail
description:
Looking for an experienced e-mail developer to create an HTML for our transactional e-mail. It's a very clean/simple e-mail template with a few personalized fields. The mail that you will build is the one every customer receives right after they complete a rental. We have the design and the HTML of the old transactional email. Within the zip file you will find the new design. It's called 'Transactionele mail design_DEF'. This is the design I want you to HTML :) 

Within the email there are some personalized fields. I Highlighted those fields in the old HTML document. Here is a list:

- Total rental price (Totaalbedrag in Dutch mail) = €TOTAL_PRICE
- Rental date (e.g. 28 oktober 2021 in Dutch mail) = START_DATE
- First Name ('Willem' in Dutch mail) = firstName
- Driving Price ('Rijden' in Dutch mail) =  €DRIVING_PRICE
- Parking price ('Parkeren' in Dutch mail) = €PARKING_PRICE
- Driving hours.minutes ('Gereden minuten' In Dutch mail = DRIVING_HOURS u DRIVING_MINUTES min 
- Driving distance ('Reisafstand' in Dutch mail ) = DRIVING_DISTANCE km 
- Parking hours/minutes ('Parkeerminuten' In Dutch mail)( = PARKING_HOURS u PARKING_MINUTES min

There is only 1 CTA in this mail 'klantenservice'. This https://nl.go-sharing.com/contact/ link should be included.

All the visuals you see in the design are included in the Zip file. 

Hopefully you have enough information to do the job :) 

Thanks in advance and kind regards,

Willem Steenbeek

title: Build a simple iOS Banking App (About 3 Hours To Do, No Need to Deploy to App Store)
description:
Hi there, 

I'm seeking an experienced iOS mobile developer to build a very simple banking iOS application.  It should only take about three hours to build. I'll provide you with the specifications and files. Here's the features: 

## Features 
* Show a list of transactions corresponding to an account ([iOS.Transactions.png](./iOS.Transactions.png))
* Example data has been included in [exercise.json](./exercise.json)
* On this screen, the account information on top scrolls off the screen ([iOS.Transactions.scrolling.png](iOS.Transactions.scrolling.png))
* Note that both cleared and pending transactions should be shown together in descending date order

## Requirements

* Swift please.
* Programmatic UI. No Storyboards or xib files.
* No `SwiftUI`. We want to see how you construct views with `UIKit`.
* The required [image files](./images) have been supplied.
* For styling reference, see the file [styling.reference.png](./styling.reference.png)

## Features

* Group transactions by date
* Some transactions will be ATM withdrawals. These rows should be indicated by the location icon.
* Tapping on an ATM withdrawal row will show the location of the ATM on a map (iOS.Map.png)
    - It is a good idea to display location details on the annotation.
* Make this a universal app supporting iPad
* Dark Mode support
* Dynamically pull down data from [https://www.dropbox.com/s/tewg9b71x0wrou9/data.json?dl=1](https://www.dropbox.com/s/tewg9b71x0wrou9/data.json?dl=1)
* Implement an algorithm that will give the user a projected spend over the next two weeks

title: Telegram Referral Contest Bot
description:
Member Registers for the cycle:
1)	Member types /command in group chat
2)	Bot DMs the member and deletes /command from group chat
3)	Bot DMs UNREGISTERED member following:
          a.	General info
          b.	Option to participate
4)	If member chooses to participate, he/she is given:
          a.	Input field for necessary info from his/her side
                  i.	Full Name
                 ii.	Email
                iii.	Wallet Address (in case of winning competition where prize should be sent)
          b.	Dedicated invite group link (unique for every registered member)
          c.	General info

How does bot count?
1)	User must be a member of a group in order to register for the contest with the bot
2)	User must have set TG Username in order to register for the contest with the bot
3)	Bot must be counting members that joined from the link
4)	If member leaves group referral count of the user by whose link member joined is updated accordingly
5)	Bot must count only members with the TG Username
6)	Bot must count only members that were last online lo longer than X days ago (X must be adjustable by group administrator)

Contest Mechanics:
1)	Contest will be hosted in cycles of weeks
2)	Origin Time is adjustable by group administrator which is (day of the week, time zone, time)
3)	Old cycle finishes and new starts on Origin Time
4)	Once one cycle is finished another one starts automatically
5)	Once cycle ends bot posts report in the group and DMs winners

Group administrator can start bot:
1)	anytime (given cycle will end on Origin Time)
2)	tell the bot to start cycle on the next Origin Time

Group administrator can stop bot:
1)	once the ongoing cycle finishes Bot does not start next one automatically
2)	Bot momentarily stops working and counts data and announces winners with the given data in time without continuing cycle until the Origin Time.
3)	Bot momentarily stops working and terminates cycle without announcing winners.

This bot must also be requiring Captcha when users join the group
And another Captcha when users try to register for the contest

title: Web Portal Comms. Network to reduce Aircraft Downtime for Supply Chain Risks, Disruptions & delays.
description:
PROJECT

Web Portal Digital communication network application for rapid response to short notice demand, bridging supply-chain gaps and reducing AOGs across locations exposed to high risk of disruption and prolonged delays.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION

I need a MVP prototype of a web portal consisting of suppliers, sub-suppliers, airlines, OEMs, maintenance providers and repair shops, bolted together with a collaborative marketplace, to demonstrate how fast provisioning solutions can be achieved for Aircraft On The Ground (AOG), critical and parts support for distressed and stranded aircraft, for the airlines.

Provisioning solutions start with an RFQ being issued to suppliers and suppliers responding with confirmation of the part, part price, accompanying documentation and estimated time of delivery.  However, the process can be slow, unreliable, and subject to inaccuracies. The prototype marketplace uniquely encourages collaboration of resources and inventory availability across multiple suppliers simultaneously, to the financial benefit of both the Airline and Supplier.

The prototype needs to demonstrate how the network self-proliferates with sales teams, planning/buyers, AOG desk operatives and technicians/engineers across multiple levels of suppliers and sub-supplier tiers, airlines and holders of large and diversified inventories. The prototype needs to provide a live communication platform for sharing AOG matters, experiences and advice from AOG, Planning/Buying, Technical and Sales desks connected to the network. 

TARGET AUDIENCES:
 
Target Audience 1
Age: 35-50
Occupation: Airline or Supplier AOG Desk (Operative / Manager)
Challenges: May not be open to change 

Target Audience 2
Age: 25-45

FUNCTIONALITIES

See functional decomposition attached for primary features, the prototype doesn’t have to include all features and functionality specified.

MOCKUPS

See draft wireframes attached

BUDGET

Fixed Contract $500

DELIVERY

1 MONTH

title: Build responsive Wordpress site with dynamic report generation functionality
description:
I am looking for assistance with converting a Figma design to a Wordpress website, particularly focused on functionality. This means that dynamic pages and dynamic content need to be created, while most static pages will be created by our in-house team after your development project is complete. Pages and fields for this development project will be explicitly specified.

Overview
This is a multi-vendor listing website, with a member area for both the buyer and supplier. There is no e-commerce functionality: suppliers are listed, they do not pay to be listed.

The supplier completes a Questionnaire as part of their on-boarding, where they give various business information for approval. Upon Questionnaire completion, the supplier has the option to generate a Results Report based on the Questionnaire.

Before a buyer has registered, they can perform an example supplier search, that shows dummy information and an Example Report. The buyer registers with basic information, and gets in contact with the site owner (offline) to settle subscription details and payment. No payments are accepted and no invoices are managed through this website. Once subscribed, the site owner/admin will approve the buyer on the website, which enables the buyer to access their buyer profile and perform full supplier searches. An approved buyer has access to dynamic, generated Supplier Reports; these reports can take the form of either a multi-page report based on 1 supplier (Supplier Report), or a 1-page comparative report of up to 3 suppliers (Supplier Comparison). 

Selected sections of the Questionnaire, Results Report, Supplier Report and Supplier Comparison are in-scope for this project; the remaining pages are out of scope, and marked as such on the Figma design. The Example Report is in scope. 

A user can register as both buyer and supplier with the same login details, and they can switch between their supplier and buyer dashboards from the navigation bar.

More granular details are included in the attached Project Brief document.

In the future as we expand our team there are opportunities to take on a more product manager role, or focus on the front end.

Working environment

We need someone with a native level of English. international mindset is a must. It is important that you can deeply understand the users, and have solid people skills. Studying abroad, and Chinese language are an advantage but not necessary. We are a startup and looking for a developer who is truly full stack, who can code, hire, recruit, manage, understand UX deeply, with the potential to move into a more senior role as we expand.

This enables us to move fast and achieve our ambitious targets. Stack is Django and WordPress, PostgreSQL and MySQL, AWS and shared hosting. Supporting stack involves Ansible, Gitlab CI, Docker.

We highly value the ability to learn, being open minded, caring about others, service, and a get stuff done attitude. We expect you’ll have a strong track record of developing high quality products before, high standards of excellence and entrepreneurial tendency.

The salary is competitive, with full social insurance and visa support for internationals with stock options to join as an owner. You’ll be surrounded by the smartest people in the industry who are fun to work with and great to learn from. Results oriented culture with flexible schedule and national and international travel opportunities.

The next step

Sound interesting to you? We’d love to hear from you. Please send us a message with more info about previous projects and what your role was and what you achieved and we can set up a time for a call.

Our requirements:
- PHP runs in your blood
- WordPress is your foundation
- Laravel is not completely new to you

The working environment:

title: Android application Take away service
description:
I have a very small budget to automate take-out orders without payment. payment is made on site in cash.


I'll put the details down and you can tell me what it's possible to do depending on time and budget :)

Thank you

Détails :

The application must have an admin side and a client side.

The admin side:

Ability to create a restaurant (The customer can choose the restaurant from the list of available restaurants)

For each restaurant, the admin must be able to create categories (Pizza drink)

For each category the admin must be able to create articles
Name of the article Price of the article and the photo of the article.

he must be able to consult the list of orders in progress and the list of orders canceled or carried out.


Client side:

the customer must be able to register at the beginning
Name, Address (Location / google maps), Phone number

registration must be validated by a validation sms with a code

once registered and connected, the customer can choose his restaurant and start filling his basket.

To validate his basket, he is asked to validate the address, otherwise he can change it and if he has special instructions for his order.

Once the order has been validated by the customer, the order arrives at the restaurant on the pc! (software to be provided for displaying orders)

once the order has arrived the cashier consults it validates it (a notification is sent to the customer "your order "order number" is validated and is being prepared the customer can consult the status of his order from the application)

the cashier prints the ticket of the order "NAME of the customer, number of the order detail of the order obviously and the address of the customer)

once the order is ready the cashier validates again and a notification is sent to the customer your order is ready.

I am available for any additional information

title: Senior Golang Microservices developer for modern cloud platform
description:
The workplace as we know it is about to transform. Who doesn’t love the hybrid way of working? GOGET’s mission is to help companies in their struggle to offer flexible work and at the same time adapt their physical workspace to the new normal. Our customers range from large international corporations to the little guy. We work hard to create solutions that help our users in their everyday challenges to manage their workspace and make people happy. Examples of what we do include digital tools to help plan and effectively execute on strategies for smart utilization of shared resources such as meeting rooms and desks. When it’s time to go to the office, GOGET is there to help build a great place to work!

The IT team is responsible for maintaining our existing product portfolio as well as making headway into a new era for us, the new Google Cloud based microservices platform. With the power of the cloud and our modern architecture we are developing new smart tools which help customers lessen their workload and brighten their day at the office.

As a Golang Cloud Developer at GOGET, you’ll join a small but cozy group of diverse international talent, who are creative and like to push code to the limit of what it can do in building the next generation of our cloud based software.

This is a unique opportunity to grow your technical skills by working with a modern tech stack based on Golang microservices running on Google Cloud Platform. If you’re passionate about coding we’d like to meet you.

Your daily responsibilities can range from the following:
● Together with the team further implement, optimize and maintain our backend software.
● Provide backend solutions to assist frontend functionalities.
● Transform product owner's demands into technical requirements and solution design.
● Provide feedback to product owners about the progress of the development, having a customer-centric mindset.
● Maintain and manage the databases on which the backend relies.
● Maintain and manage the GCP infrastructure that is the backbone of the backend.
● Implement a high level of security for the backend microservices and infrastructure.

You have the following:
● Experience in implementing and maintaining a backend microservice architecture and its cloud infrastructure.
● A person who is comfortable in taking ownership and solving problems, who loves to learn new skills and technologies and drive decisions on architecture and technology level.
● Good team player and capable of providing backend solutions to assist frontend functionalities.

title: Senior Full stack Angular Developer
description:
We are a software development Company based in Norwich, UK having recently relocated from the US. We have an insurance claims system used by various types of maritime companies.  The system is currently client/server and we are in the process of redevelopment to a cloud application utilising Angular 11.0.  It is a large, complex system handling sensitive information and familiarity with privacy requirements and security of personal data is essential .  Following closely technical specs provided is critical along with feedback when an instruction is not clear.
The ideal candidate would be able to overlap with our Project Manager and have familiarity with application configuration and deployment with knowledge of Azure infrastructure.
We are looking for a part time resource to complement our existing team.  Hourly engagement for several months.
Role
Senior Angular and .NET Core Engineer who is strong in all the most common development technologies.  Strong knowledge of SQL Server required.  In addition to strong technical aptitudes, backed by at least 7+ years of in the trenches experience, this person is a good communicator and a person who can operate in critical situations. This person should be able to execute with a high degree of success in integrating and/or resolving issues with Angular web applications.

Responsibilities: 
• Responsible for development of new, as well as maintenance of existing Angular web applications
• Takes ownership of tasks and follows through to ensure complete resolution 
• Takes a personal interest in, and responsibility for, quality of work they perform or are associated with 
• Ability to pay close attention to detail while performing technically detailed tasks 
• Ability to provide accurate time estimates for how long a task will take 
• Ability to articulate technical information clearly and simply to non-technical people 
• Enjoys helping people to the extent that no problem is considered mundane, no matter how simple the solution 
• Enjoys sharing information, supporting others, and working on a team to achieve team goals 

Skills/Knowledge 
• Backend experience in C# and ASP .NET Core (MVC, Web, API etc.).
• Frontend: HTML & CSS, js/Typescript, Angular.
• Intimate knowledge of T-SQL/SQL Server and Entity Framework.
• Toolset includes Visual Studio, git, TFS and Windows. 
• Familiarity with Agile; unit integration and end-to-end testing; team based development 
• Familiarity with Application Insights is important.
• Azure SQL Database experience is important.
•	Familiarity with Always encrypted and database column masking of benefit.

title: [7M users] TypeScript Backend Engineer Needed with experience in Java
description:
Scrolller.com is a rapidly expanding, entertaining website that offers users incredible content. We're a small, and fast-paced team of people who are dedicated to making Scrolller (7 million monthly active users) the best it can be. We're searching for individuals that are passionate about the product they're developing and who show that passion in their work.

It's even better if you've been a long-time Scrolller user!

If you secure the role, then you’ll be collaborating within the Scrolller team to provide a fantastic experience to our users. You’ll be working alongside two other full-stack developers to deliver new features, and to enhance existing ones. Our UI/UX designer will work with the developers to prototype solid user flows and interfaces, which you can then implement in production. We’d like you to bring along your own ideas and feedback, and also to help us refine our ideas. Please add the Scrolller’s MAU to the top of your application or it will be ignored.

Our frontend is a single-page web application built with React and TypeScript. Our backend is written in Kotlin and hosts a GraphQL API. We’ll guide you through the codebase once you join to help you settle in. Our goal is to refactor the Kotlin backend to our typescript backend.  If you have Java experience that will be enough to help us. Soon we’re going to create a Scrolller app for mobile, so experience here would be a big plus.

Experience Required in the following:

- TypeScript
- Java knowledge
- HTTP requests
- SQL - specifically PostgreSQL
- GraphQL - queries, mutations, subscriptions
- Node.js

Good to have:

- Prisma (for PostgreSQL in TypeScript)
- MongoDB (for transition PostgreSQL to MongoDB)
