title: Looking for A Web Designer/UI/UX Specialists
description:
We are a US-Based marketing agency that provides web design and development services to business owners. These are typically E-commerce or service businesses and or companies needing app design/development. We are looking for a long term relationships. Someone (individual/team) that is fast and can get the work done and exceed our expectations. We are looking for designers who are creative and have a great eye for good designs.

We are looking for long-term collaborators that are willing to put a creative approach to the problems we will face and can bring substantial, clean, and professional web/mobile/app/graphic/banner design skills. Please start your proposal with the word 'Nyfty' so I can see you are reading this. We love out-of-the-box ideas and implementing them so if you have an imagination then bring it on!

Furthermore, we will have needs to create creatives (images for ads, modify stock imagery, business card, branding guides etc.....) Anything to do with Brand and/or ad/imagery modification. We do allot of Websites/Mobile Web, Apps and brand designs.

MUST HAVE extensive web design UI/UX and APP UI/UX experience.

We can work based on Figma (greatly preferred), Adobe XD, Photoshop PSDs, or anything else that can be opened by our developers. This is a team-oriented company, and we love to grow and aspire to become the best version of ourselves! Please apply if you match the following:

**Skills Required:**

- 4+ Years of Web Design experience
- Basic understanding of WordPress and how themes are used. Elementor theme design experience a HUGE plus.
- Proficiency using prototyping/design solutions: Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud (Adobe XD, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator), Invision and/or Sketch.
- Awareness of good UI/UX principles.
- Awareness of good site structure from a marketing strategy perspective
- Able to manipulate images, edit, and remove subjects from the background.
- Basic understanding of Search Engine Optimization principles

**Other Requirements:**

- A portfolio or list to show your work (you will be immediately denied if you have no display of previous work.)
- Basic understanding of WordPress “drag-and-drop”/”WISIWIG” builders (like Elementor, DIVI, Beaver Builder, etc) and the limitations they sometimes present.
- Willing to work with a team
- You will be responsible for wire framing, prototyping and full design from start to finish.
- Willingness to accept critique and make revisions based on feedback
- Ability to work on multiple projects and complete projects in a timely manner
- Willingness to learn and a desire to grow in your profession
- Being fast, effective and following advanced design principles are necessary. We work predominantly in wordpress and use themes like Jupiter and Elementor.

NECESSARY:
* Must be organized and use our project manager solutions/click up to build out projects and timelines and work flows. The people/person we choose will be required to build out projects based on scope and time/needs.
* must be able to research customer industries and how those industries conduct themselves visually and do it better.
* We will only accept the very best quality of design. You will work with our project manager and you must use OUR slack platform to communicate with our team and you must either track the hours via upwork or using our platform hubstaff. (We do not allow manual time input.)
* You/team following the best practices as outlined on this site: http://photoshopetiquette.com/
    * This means proper layer naming, organization into groups and folders, deleting unused layers, etc. as explained on that website.

Please submit your proposal letter together with your work portfolio. Looking forward to working with you!

title: Trading Community Technical Lead Developer
description:
About us:
TARGET HIT! Is a trading community looking to empower individuals who seeks to become the best version of themselves through mastering the goal of becoming a consistently profitable trader. We provide the finest technical analysis, trading knowledge and crypto-currencies trade alerts.


Summary of the job:
You will be responsible for leading a development team on efforts affecting multiple projects. This position will provide technical leadership for projects and team through code reviews, ensuring best technical practices are applied. This position will be responsible for reporting progress of development activities and ensuring the success of the team by providing regular direction, mentorship, and coaching to team members.  


Job Responsibilities:
* Directs, coaches and mentors team members to ensure engagement and productivity levels are maintained; provides regular and consistent feedback and communication throughout the year and during performance reviews.
* Understand the goals and strategy behind each project from conception through completion. 
* Lead team of developers to make sure each project meets or exceeds the goals are set out to achieve.
* Serve as a project lead working with management and team members in development of projects by task delegation and timeline management. 
* Provide input into improving efficiency of the project deliverables, offering advice and thoughts and providing feedback. Estimate the time and tools required to complete a project.
* Ensure all developments are fully documented, meet high level development requirements e.g. data, customer experience, architecture, security, quality & operations, as well as regulatory & industry standards so projects are fit for purpose leaving testing & transitioning to live.
* Accurately report all development activity through status reports, report on development progress and issues, identifying remedial action when required to address problems and keep development on track.
* Demonstrate a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Work within project timelines and budgets.
* Participate in team activities and team planning with the aim of improving team skills, awareness and quality of work.
* Maintains regular and predictable attendance.


Job requirements:
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering or related fields– good to have.
* 5+ years of software and web development experience required
* Superior analytical, evaluative, communication, leadership, entrepreneurial, and problem-solving skills, with a clear focus in achieving goals and embodiment for a fast-paced and result-oriented environment

title: Need Multiple Developers to Join Our Team
description:
This is for a long-term job and we could give you good work for years!

Some of our designers and programmers have been working with us for 10+ years already which means we are a stable Company.

We are currently looking for WordPress Developers (number of hours to be decided) responsible for both back-end and front-end development. This position requires deep knowledge of Wordpress, PHP, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Elementor (theme development) and also a good eye for aesthetics. You will manage the end-to-end development process: , (development and deployment). Experience with responsive and adaptive design is absolutely required. You must also have extensive experience with site speed and optimization skills using gtmetrix, google lighthouse and pingdom while still maintaining the integrity of the theme.

By applying to this job you certify that you have read the entire job post carefully and agree to its terms. You agree the points in this description will be a legal contract between us if hired!

Our ideal WordPress developer is fast, flexible, proactive, a team player who is highly skilled, confident, and curious. You will be a part of our Website Design/Development team, working alongside Programmers, Designers, and Illustrators with the objective to constantly push our concepts and make them into something substantial.

We work in a creative, productive and fast-paced environment so being able to work effectively by yourself and also work as part of a team is critical. If you are looking for constant guidance then you are NOT at the level required for this job! You need to be able to recognize and act when Website content is out of date and needs to be updated without being specifically told so.

All non-spam applications must include the words “Nyfty” at the start of the application to show me that you actually took the time to read the requirements.

All of our team members are on-boarded to our project management system which you will be expected to use and collaborate effectively with other team members on. Knowledge of working in an Agile scrum environment is a required. Knowledge of Clickup/Jira is all necessary.

Responsibilities:

* Work as a Team Member with our design team
* Manage and update Wordpress Websites
* You must have a good working headset so that you can clearly communicate with low noise and no echo on our team in zoom conferences!
* Collaboration with Concept Team on various brainstorming sessions to define and implement innovative ideas to our Websites.
* Understand established design guidelines.
* Communicating design ideas in conjunction with our design team using user flows, process flows, site maps and wireframes.
* Assist in creating Wire-frames, Mockups and Blueprints for Website layouts using figma and/or other wireframing technologies.
* Being able to critically think through issues and come up with resolutions to problems or stumbling blocks.
* Use Slack to communicate with different team members
* Use Jira/Click Up for Agline/Scrum project management
* Website Design experience + knowledge of CSS, HTML, JS in addition to being a great WordPress Developer will be considered as an advantage.
* Cross Browser testing/functional implimentation
* Site speed optimization (Gtmetrix, Google Lighthouse and Pingdom) - EVERY site must be A or better.

We are looking forward to a great application.

If you are chosen, we can give you exciting steady work for years to come!

title: Build a new translation management system with React
description:
We are Simply Translate, a translation company from Amsterdam, The Netherlands, with a focus on improving the technology behind the translation process. At the moment we enable customers to automatically order translation projects through our platform. We are in the process of revamping this platform and we have already had a design made for this purpose. 

Currently we have two in house developers. In order to create this new platform in React from scratch we seek the help of an additional expert in this field. We envision that you would be an integral (remote) part of our team for the duration of the project. The scope has been defined, but we do not know how long the project will take. It will at least take 1 month. We prefer 40 hours a week, but at least 32.

- the platform -:
Building a translation management platform comes with its own interesting challenges. It is incomparable with a regular webshop. In the translation world we deal with many dependent systems where the content lives. Numerous types of document formats. And complex algorithms to analyse texts. 
Out platform enables customers to manually create new translation projects, but also allows customers to automatically integrate their existing cms. We offer a wide range of options to choose from, for example different qualities of translations. The payment process is facilitated by an integrated wallet. 

- how we work -
When you decide to work with us, we envision the following process. We will present the new design of the platform and we will make a plan accordingly. We have already setup an initial React project that is connected to our backend system using NextJS. We will stay responsible for the backend endpoints, which are documented in an API documentation. There will be close communication through Slack and Teams throughout the entire project. In order to support where needed we will have a daily stand-up and weekly functional checkup as well.

description:
I created a React.js App for learning purposes. The backend is made with Node.js /Express.js. It scrapes with Puppeteer data from a website. Everything is fine but I cannot get to retieve the Json with the scraped data throug Axios making  GET POST UPDATE nor DELETE request.

The job consists of :
1- Stablish the way to React retrieve the Json with the scrapped data through the Api (which already exists). Now the writes a Json file on the client folder, which i think is the reason why i cannot build on production.
2- React from the frontend uploads a new data to scrappe a new tiker. Now even if the frontend is made, I have to write on a Json file that Puppeteers reads to scrappe that data.
3- React has to be the ability to delete a Data from the Scrappe Json.
4- Now Puppeteer scrapes the whole Json object with all the adata added. But I think is better to scrappe one by one.
5- MongoDB installation, now is pointing ti Atlas but the num er of contacts are full very quickly

The job maybe looks large but all the pieces are already done, and could be achieved very soon. In the future we can keep working on other projects.

title: Develop a Robust Church Management System WordPress Plugin
description:
Hello, we need a custom interactive plugin for church that works like Pushpay’s ChurchStaq or Church community builder system and is capable of handling the following features or components for Church:
Church cell/small groups management
Multi-location specific member management
Learning Management similar to Buddyboss
Online Giving/Donation and Account Reconciliation Features
Worship planning
Check-In system for Church such as kids ministry 
Event Schedule
Volunteer and staff scheduling 
Administration 
Growth Process Map 
Communication 

The purpose is to have a community feature on the Church's WordPress website where users/members can signup for an account, join or be added to a cell group where they can interact, and hold virtual meetings with a simple interface where they can manage their account on the frontend with an admin moderation and management.

The Buddyboss platform group is similar but not close to what we want. We want a group that is specific to Church.

People in the Cell or small groups system should be able to do the following listed below.

1. Join a virtual meeting and be able to interact using tools like chat, add members to the group, invite members to join the group, assign follow-up tasks to cell group leaders.
2. Internal messaging system among group members - the leader of the group should have a tool to communicate with group members on the GO
3. Support Life Events celebration of group members such as Birthdays, Wedding Anniversary, etc.
4. Receive messages and communication from the central office through the Admin channel
5. Simple interface which has very specific tools
6. Be able to integrate a web and mobile app version
7. Multi-lingual capability for global integration
8. Integrate other in-demand or scheduled resources such as Daily Bible Reading, Daily Supernatural Revelations, and daily prayers from the Pastors.

title: Add ecommerce to a weebly website for event venue
description:
Convert a pdf order form to ecommerce functionality on existing weebly website.

We are an events & functions venue catering for engagement parties, birthdays, weddings and more. Our customers currently order their food, drinks/bar tab and extras for their function (e.g. photobooth) via a pdf form (see attached).

We want to add e-commerce functionality to our weebly website that allows customers to order all of the necessary items for their function online.

Specifications/logic required for e-commerce


- User nominates total number of guests attending event
- User nominates which space they are booked into (Turkish lounge, Courtyard, Entire venue (Lounge + Courtyard

Food
- User selects from 1 of 3 food package options (light $20, standard $25, deluxe $30).
- User selects number of guests food packages are for (20-300)
- User can only choose specific menu items based on package selection
- User can also order grazing table, platters, and corporate packages
- User can add notes for food 

Drinks
- User selects drink packages options (2, 3, or 4 hours). 
- Each drinks package has a "Standard" or "with spirits" option, which changes package price 
- The drinks packages ordered must equal the "total number of guests" for function
- User can order "bar tab" of any $ value
- User can add notes for drinks

Other
- User must meet minimum spends for each space before they can check-out the cart (Courtyard $3000, Turkish lounge $2000, Turkish lounge + courtyard - $5000
- A deposit of $500  is automatically subtracted from the cart total

title: CodeIgniter and cURL

The problem is that our login will be given to many students which we don't really want because they will also have access to the billing page where they can add search credits or even cancel the subscription!

I have already setup the login system including the file uploads and everything, the remaining work is the cURL only.

title: Full Stack Technical Lead
description:
Full Stack Technical Lead Role Description

The Full-Stack Technical Lead is responsible for the planning and management for the technical aspects of a project. You will report to and work with the Project Lead to ensure that delivery expectations are clear and met within budget.

You must have 3-5 years of experience with full-stack, as well as mobile app development. Experience with games, AR, or VR development is a plus.

This is a full-time position, and we expect the workload to be up to 40 hours a week. You will be expected to be available to attend daily stand-ups, coordinate with a distributed multidisciplinary team, and complete all tasks on time and to specification. This is a remote work contract, but the worker must be available for 6 hours of overlap time with California (PST) daily.

Role Overview
- Work with sales and the General Manager to create and review production plans prior to kickoff and ensure a contract that can be successfully delivered is signed. 
- Interview potential new team members.
- Report on team members' progress and the quality of their work. 
- Oversee a team and ensure that they are implementing high-quality code.
- Create architecture, task lists, and technical design documents for assigned projects. 
- Review task descriptions and deliverables on high-importance items.
- Review task descriptions and deliverables on tasks completed by new hires.
- Attend team meetings, including project kick-offs, stand-ups, and additional meetings as required.
- Contribute to projects as and when time allows.

Qualifications & Skills:
The ability to step into a project, determine the best path forward for that project’s needs, describe and then execute that plan is the most important skill for you to have. Past that;
- Experience taking mobile apps from concept through to live in the app store. 
- Experience launching websites.
- Experience in MongoDB, Express, React, Node. Unity, C#, Flutter, and Firebase are preferred.
- Write clean, efficient, well-documented code.
- Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate issues and report project design and status to a diverse non-technical audience.
- Must be detail-oriented, quality-driven, straightforward, self-motivated, and proactive.
- Able to work independently, creatively, and track multiple deadlines to success.
- Able to accept constructive feedback on your work.
- Proven ability to multi-task and manage multiple complex initiatives simultaneously.
- Proven history working in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams.
- Previous experience in developing games or applications and implementing best practices.
- Experienced with software development methodologies as well as build and release procedures.
- Experience with project management or task tracking systems such as JIRA, Trello, or Pivotal Tracker preferred.

About Robot Sea Monster

We are a digital production studio with an extensive background in games, AR/VR, and commercial application development.  Founded in 2012, the studio has successfully shipped over 38 products, serving major brands such as Blue Shield, Pearson, LO3 Energy, Occipital, and Sizzle Entertainment.  Our work has been profiled in major media outlets, such as The New York Times, CNBC, TED, and more.

Working Conditions

We are a fully remote company with team members across the globe.  Team members are expected to have high-speed internet suitable for both work and voice calls.  Team members must have a functional microphone with a clean audio to communicate with the rest of the team.  Additional tools required for the position must be supplied by the team member with exceptions only for exceptionally proprietary software or hardware required for a project.

title: Wordpress ACF hierarchy extention + ninja table filter
description:
Situation:

-	Parents: Projecten

-	Children: eenheden

-	Every project page will contain and display multiple children.


Questions / mission

-	In the admin page of the project page it is posisible to create new children (eenheden)
	This should be limited so one can anly create children of the project of the project admin page of which the children are created on.

e.g. I am on the project edit page of project 002. On this page I can add children. These children should be automatically become children of project002.
So:
		Project002
			Child01-pro002
			Child02-pro002
			Child03-pro001
	And so on
 

	
-	The Parents, “projecten” are displaying  table on their body with an overview of all children. This table is created by a shortcode coming from Ninja tables.
Here we need the same sort of relatation, so that each project page table, only shows related child pages that are related to the parent page that the tbale is showed on.

So:

	Project page 003 table shows:

		Child01-pro003
		Child02-pro003
		Child03-pro003
		Child04-pro003

And so on

 
Needs to be only the children (eenheden) of the related parent (projecten)

All code needs to be added so that future plugin updates will not render the code obsolete (e.g. by addiing it to the child theme or..) Also, the code needs to provided in such a way that it can be extracted to the masster project (e.g. bundle as plugin or list what files changed + paths).

title: Unity Technical Lead
description:
The Unity Technical Lead is responsible for planning and architecting the technical aspects of a unity project against the design and vision communicated by the Product Owner, mentoring and overseeing a team of unity engineers in implementing that architecture, and working with the Product Owner to ensure a successful project outcome within the Unity technical stack.

You have experience converting project requirements into a robust and documented technical architecture, with breakouts of tasks and time estimates for a team. You are able to communicate technical concepts with a team of both technical and non-technical members. You have experience implementing scalable and performant Unity applications. Your technical knowledge extends to interacting with network interfaces to permit your application to participate in a larger project ecosystem. Experience with Unity WebGL, JSLib and Javascript, and other frameworks is a plus.

You will be expected to virtually attend team and client meetings. Consistent internet and clear verbal communication is a requirement.

This is a full time position, with a workload of up to 40 hours a week. You will be expected to be available to attend daily stand ups, coordinate with a distributed multidisciplinary team, and complete all tasks on time and to specification. Consistent internet and clear verbal and nonverbal communication is a requirement. This is a remote work contract, and you must be  available for 6 hours of overlap time with California (PST) daily, between 9am-5pm PST.


Role Overview
* Create architecture design and documentation and task lists for assigned projects.
* Implement high quality code, and ensure the team does as well.
* Attend team meetings, including project kick-offs, stand ups, and additional meetings as required.
* Work in partnership with a non-technical Project Coordinator to keep the Product Owner informed on the technical aspects and progress of the project.
* Review and comment on technical deliveries by other team members, and mentor them towards improvement where necessary.
* Clear written and verbal communications in English; additional languages a plus.

Ideal Candidate
* The ability to step into a project and determine the best technical ecosystem for that project’s needs and then move into operating in that ecosystem is the most important skill for you to have. Past that;
* Experience in Unity and API driven networking is required.
* Experience with Unity JSLib interfaces and Javascript coding is preferred.
* Write clean, efficient, well-documented code, and help those around you to do so..
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate issues and report project design and status to a diverse non-technical audience.
* Must be detail oriented, quality driven, straightforward, self-motivated, and proactive.
* Able to work independently, creatively, and track multiple deadlines to success.
* Able to accept constructive feedback on your work.
* Proven ability to multi-task and manage multiple complex initiatives simultaneously.
* Proven history working in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams.
* Previous experience in developing games or applications and implementing Unity best practices.
* Experienced with software development methodologies as well as build and release procedures.
* Experience with project management or task tracking systems such as JIRA, Trello, or Monday preferred.
* Must have at least 4 hours overlap with the Studio time 9am to 5pm PST.


About Robot Sea Monster

We are a digital production studio with an extensive background in games, AR/VR, and commercial application development.  Founded in 2012, the studio has successfully shipped over 38 products, serving major brands such as Blue Shield, Pearson, LO3 Energy, Occipital, and Sizzle Entertainment.  Our work has been profiled in major media outlets, such as The New York Times, CNBC, TED, and more. We are looking to add team members who want to make products that delight, educate and amaze.

Working Conditions

We are a fully remote company with team members across the globe. Team members are expected to have high speed internet suitable for both work and voice calls. Team members must have a functional microphone with clean audio to communicate with the rest of the team. Additional tools required for the position must be supplied by the team member with exceptions only for exceptionally proprietary software or hardware required for a project. 

Expected Hours of Work

Some flexibility in hours is allowed, but all team members must have at least 4 hours overlap with the studio time 9am to 5pm PST. Monday through Friday. Workers must be available via Google Hangout, email, and Slack during designated work hours. Additional hours may be required when project completion deadlines must be met as well as for periodic client meetings. Hours will fluctuate based upon number of projects, project scale, and project timelines.

title: OG tags integration
description: An effective job title wiil typically include a general term, the level of experience and any special requirements. The general term will optimize your job title to show up in a general search for jobs of the same nature. The level of experience will help you attract the most qualified applicants by outlining the amount of responsibility and prior knowledge required. And if your position is specialized, consider including the specialization in the job title as well. But avoid using internal titles, abbreviations or acronyms to make sure people understand what your job posting is before clicking

title: Design and Develop A User-Friendly and Beautiful WordPress Website With 5-7 Webpages
description:
----- Overall Requirement ------
Looking for a web development team who is able to design, build and test a full-fledged WordPress Site from scratch, basically able to perform the full web development cycle.

This team should consist of at least a UI/UX designer, graphic designer and a web developer who is capable of building custom WordPress themes from scratch.

This team should be able to create a custom theme of which content can be updated on WordPress UI or admin panel.

----- Relevant Industries ------
Science, Consumer Appliance Technology, Healthcare, Beverages

----- Main Product ------
A patented technology that is built within a household consumer appliance. This technology is able to be applied to all kinds of beverages such as coffee, tea, water, juice, wines and liquors for multiple benefits that could improve one's health.

----- Workflow ------
I will require interim steps to be completed before the coding starts, so basically the web development workflow should be adhered to
- Brief clarification
- Wireframe for site architecture and layout
- Visual and UI Design
- Graphic Design with provided assets
- Interactions and Animations
- Code Implementation
- Cross Browser and Device Testing

----- Deliverables -----
- High-fi mockups to visualise look and feel of websites
- Responsive WordPress website
- Custom theme that allows for non-code content editing such as changing out of digital assets such as images or videos or copywriting such as headlines and body copy
- QA and testing

----- Reference Sites -----
For look and feel, it should be a blend between the following 2 reference sites
https://purtier.com
https://www.conscientious.com/essence-spray-for-him/

**Please only send reference websites that are similar to my reference websites**

----- UI/UX ------
- The website should be a well-lit place for the site visitors to firstly be drawn in by an uncluttered landing page with powerful visuals
- The UX challenge here is really to be able to simplify a highly technical and difficult topic and translate that into a beautiful, intuitive and functional interface
- The primary UI/UX goal is to educate and inform in an eye-catching manner. The secondary UI/UX goal is to convince enough for them to want to learn more, request for demo or ask how to work with us

----- Timeline & Quote ------
- 2 weeks (inclusive of clearance and revisions at each stage), 
- Fixed price quotation only please

----- Please apply only if you could do the following ------
Can communicate clearly in English
Can meet project deadlines in a timely manner
Honest
Attentive to details

If you're interested to join my team, please send me similar reference websites from your portfolio that resemble my reference websites or websites that are for the relevant industries mentioned above.

Thank you very much!

title: Node.JS Backend Developer
description:
The Node.js Developer is responsible for building the server side component of our client/server projects, as well as implementing APIs and WebSocket protocols to manage the interchange of data between server and client. 

Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic and state management, definition and maintenance of the central database (SQL and NoSQL), and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to front-end requests. You must be able to carry your portions of the project from design to implementation to deployment, assisting in all areas possible.  This will include a lot of problem solving and documenting of solutions.

You will be judged on code quality, code reliability, predictability, and team communications. The Node.js Developer works with the Technical Lead and the Engineering Director to ensure that all requirements are met and all backend services are complete and deployed to meet project requirements.

This position is for a full time project expected to last 6-12 weeks or longer. This is a remote full-time position with an expected workload of up to 40 hours a week while production is active on the project. More project details can be provided in the interview. Applicants must be able to attend daily standup and work at least 4 hours of overlap with the studio’s 9am to 5pm pacific time schedule.

Role Overview
* Implement high quality server code for both monolithic and microservice based architectures
* Design and document robust API and protocol specifications for your areas, as well as necessary database architecture where required.
* Contribute to team and organizational improvements in process and infrastructure
* Create and update technical design documentation when needed.
* Attend team meetings, including project kick-offs, stand ups, and additional meetings as required. Be readily available to answer questions.

Qualifications & Skills
* In depth knowledge of Node.js, Javascript, various database systems, RESTful APIs, and Websocket protocol definitions.
* Understanding the nature of asynchronous programming and how to maximize it’s use
* Understanding accessibility and security compliance
* Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
* Creating database schemas that represent and support processes
* Must enjoy problem solving 
* Able to work in collaboration with multidisciplinary teams
* Must be detail oriented, quality driven, straightforward, self-motivated and proactive
* Able to communicate your vision to programmers, producers, and others involved in the development process
* Able to accept constructive feedback on your work
* Able to present your ideas both verbally and on paper
* Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to communicate issues and report project design to a diverse non-technical audience
* Have an awareness of the various games platforms and technologies
* Able to work independently, creatively, and track multiple deadlines to success
* Must be a team player
* Must be able to work at least 4 hours overlap with the Studio time 9am to 5pm PST.

title: Senior Full Stack Node.js Engineer (Nest.js, GraphQL, React)
description:
We are building a technical platform to implement, launch and operate web applications. Our platform will contain all modules that are common among SaaS projects like authentication, authorization, in-app messages, search, etc 

We are looking for experienced Full Stack engineers who want to build this together with us. Our backend stack consists of Nest.js, Apollo Server, TypeORM and all code is written in beautiful Typescript. 

Our APIs are exposed using GraphQL. We are integrating Postgres, Elasticsearch and RabbitMQ. In the frontend we are using React with Redux, Next.js, Apollo Client and Material UI. We deploy our application on Google Cloud Run.

Please only apply on this job if your skills have a good overlap with the technologies mentioned above plus you have a passion for good software craftsmanship (Clean Code + SOLID). 

You'll join a team of enthusiastic engineers and experienced POs. The tasks are challenging and varied.

* Duration: long-term / on-going (we build a company, not a project)
* Full-time (40h/week)
* Location: the team is distributed all over the world. We expect team members to make sure that they work close to CET timezone.
* Language: fluent english (written and spoken)

We are looking for a self-employed freelancers. No agencies please.

The interview process contains a video interview. Please don't apply if you are not ready for this.

2) track details of a query by reference number, client detail, customer address etc. 
3)inform the customer on the progress of the query by sending out email/sms notifications to the relevant recipients concerned on a query
4)track status on each query with a daily report 
5)upload comments, documents and any relevant material that could be of use in effective query resolution and in future when handling related or similar queries
6) Ability to identify which queries were allocated to a specific team member
7)Dash board with on-time information on status of each query
8) generate a report of all the activities and tasks that took place (Audit Trail)
9)Customer reports that are printable and downloadable at the end of the month and at the end of the financial year
10) To enable  access levels  on the software and enable logging on the system.
11) Bulk SMS and e-mail notifications to customers and other stakeholders on other activities 
12) A mobile app that allows consumers to submit queries and access  accounts, balances and statements remotely

title: Microservice using AWS Lambda & Elasticsearch
description:
Lambda Application (SAM)
We need a lambda application prepared for a number of predefined queries to elasticsearch. The code should be written in python and meet PEP8 standards. Beyond the code itself, the project should contain sentry, unit tests, the serverless.yml file, and an informative README file. We already have a working version, but it is part of a monolithic Django app that we are currently breaking up. We will provide the existing elasticsearch queries as part of the project.

Receiver
Also as part of this task, we need a script written to receive the results of the microservice to postgres via the original Django app. The Django app is marked as server in the diagram. While we are moving the process of tagging itself to the microservice, the Django application still needs to store the results of the microservice to postgres. The app uses Django Rest Framework. We do not need this receiver added to the project above, it can be simply shared as a file and we will add it to our app.

A key feature of SaaS, TrackTrack, is Themes. A theme is a collection of keywords and helps group and filter documents based on whether or not they contain specific keywords. We need a simple Themes microservice which:
1. receives a list of keywords (theme) along with any additional filters (see section below)
2. searches an elasticsearch index for those keywords taking into account any additional filters
3. adds the theme id to those documents (laws) that contain the keywords
4. asynchronously returns the ids of the documents (laws) to which the keywords have been added along with the theme id

We similarly need the option to:
- update themes when the keywords or other filters (more on that below) change and
- delete a theme and have the theme id removed from the elasticsearch index.

Theme example:
"О внесении изменений в водный Кодекс" AND ("закон" OR "законопроект") AND "озеро Байкал"
безопасность железнодорожный переезд железнодорожный Правила безопасности железнодорожный безопасность движения и эксплуатации на железнодорожном транспорте безопасность движения поездов обеспечение безопасности на железнодорожном транспорте переход железнодорожные пути железнодорожный неустановленных местах противопожарный режим охрана железнодорожный пожарный железнодорожный противопожарный железнодорожный Промышленная безопасность Безопасность перевозок грузов Безопасность перевозок багажа "безопасность перевозок" AND ("пассажиров" OR "багаж" OR "грузобагажа") "экологическая безопасность" AND "железнодорожный транспорт" "технический регламент " AND "безопасность" AND "железнодорожный транспорт" "транспортное происшествие" AND "железнодорожный транспорт" "крушение" AND "железнодорожный транспорт" "железнодорожный транспорт" AND "авария" "транспорт" AND "инцидент" "железнодорожный транспорт" AND "расследование причин" AND ("авария" OR "происшествие") "противопожарная опашка" "травмирование граждан" "поезд восстановительный" "безопасность высокоскоростного железнодорожного транспорта" "безопасность" AND ( "движение" OR "эксплуатация") AND "железнодорожный транспорт" "безопасность железнодорожного подвижного состава" "безопасность инфраструктуры железнодорожного транспорта" "безопасность по параметрам движения" AND "технический персонал" AND "поезд" "безопасность движения и эксплуатации" AND "технического средства" "безопасность услуг" AND "перевозка пассажиров" AND "железнодорожный транспорт" "безопасность движени и эксплуатации железнодорожного транспорта" "воздействие транспорта на окружающую среду" "Государственный надзор в области железнодорожного транспорта" "Правила нахождения граждан и размещения объектов в зонах повышенной опасности, выполнения в этих зонах работ, проезда и перехода через железнодорожные пути"

Elasticsearch mapping:
We are attaching the mapping of the elasticsearch index to be queried. The keywords should be searched for in the following fields: "title" and "text".

Additional filters:
We also need the option to only search for keywords in documents that meet additional filters. There are two types of additional filters.
title_only = True/False. This specifies that keywords should be found in either "title" or "text" or only in the "title"
"source", "category", and "document_type". If specified in the request, then for each and any of these fields the request will provide additional keywords. For example, "sources":["Правительство России"] or "sources":["Правительство России"], "document_types":["Законопроекты"]. These filters should act as AND and not OR filters.

Receiver
The receiver should be able to receive the results of the microservice using Django Rest Framework You can see the model of the Law object attached. For each document id (law id) returned by the microservice, the receiver should add or remove the theme. The id of the theme is should also be returned by the service.

Please note I respond mostly during working hours only. I plan to make a hiring decision on Monday evening, Tuesday morning.

title: Binary search on graph
description:
Import ESCO ontology in DB (Neo4j, or Postgres, or whichCRM you like)


https://ec.europa.eu/esco/portal/download

You will import all the ontology in English, latest version.

—— 

Build a program which will guess occupations from skills / qualification, running a binary search.

Kind of “Guess Who?” Game 
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guess_Who%3F



First, ask a user : “what do you do for a living ?”
User answers in free text.

Link it with one or several  entities in the graph using 
https://spacy.io/api/entitylinker


Then, run a binary search on the graph on skills and qualifications (everything BUT occupations), to find the possible job titles.

Ask a user YES/NO/MAYBE questions on skills and qualifications.

Questions will simply be in the form of the text present in the KB with a “?” 


https://github.com/j2kun/binary-search-graphs


There are 3000 occupations in the KB : you will ask 10 questions and narrow down the possible occupations to 3. 

The search ends with finding a list of 3 likely Occupations.
